# The City Farmers

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/SylB1lAep.png)



## Developing the workforce by decentralizing agriculture in blighted food deserts.

[https://thecityfarmers.org/](https://thecityfarmers.org/)

---
## 📌 **TLDR**

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/HkSJleClT.png)

### **Requesting 300,000 USDC**

- Rent a warehouse
- Purchase growing equipment and materials
- Hire a grantwriter and a videographer/editor

*Funding the research & development of urban agriculture as a public good, while proliferating Nouns ⌐◨-◨*

---

## 🧑‍🌾 **Background/Problem Statement**

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/S1o4vxAla.jpg)
*📝 Map of low-income and low-access areas in the U.S. 
Source: Economic Research Service, U.S. Department of Agriculture*

Food access is a multi-faceted issue. Because food has not been treated as a public good, **over 1.1 billion people globally, including ~10% of the U.S., are food insecure;** meaning they have limited access to stores that offer a variety of healthy and affordable food. This creates severe challenges:
### Public Health
- **Stunted Childhoods and Learning Disorders**: "Longitudinal studies in Canada indicate that hunger is related to poor health outcomes, including a higher risk of depression and suicidal ideation in adolescents, and chronic conditions, particularly asthma. In addition, nutrient deficiencies, such as iron deficiency, are known to impair learning and cause decreased productivity in school-age children, and maternal depressive disorders." - [Food insecurity and hunger: A review of the effects on children’s health and behaviour](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4373582/)
- **Cardiovascular Disease**: A study published in [the Journal of the American Heart Association](https://www.ahajournals.org/doi/full/10.1161/JAHA.119.014629) included more than 27,000 adults surveyed from 1999 to 2014. Researchers found more cardiovascular disease and higher overall death rates among those reporting food insecurity.
- **Obesity**: "Highly energy-dense processed foods that are high in saturated fats, sugars, and sodium are consumed more often than micronutrient-dense quality foods. Energy-dense foods may help meet daily caloric requirements, but essential nutrients are missing. Therefore, in many countries, undernutrition and obesity coexist and both can be consequences of food insecurity." - [Food insecurity as a risk factor for obesity: A review](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC9549066/)
### Economic Opportunity
Individuals who live in low-income, low-access neighborhoods tend to deal with employment challenges. This is often due to a lack of economic opportunity in their neigborhood, a lack of positive role models, and interactions with the criminal justice system.
### Global Supply Chains
In the United States, processed foods travel an average of 1,300 miles (~2,100 KM), and fresh produce travels an average of 1,500  miles (~2,400 KM) to get to your local grocery store. - [Food Miles: Background and Marketing](https://attra.ncat.org/publication/food-miles-background-and-marketing/#:~:text=The%20Leopold%20Center%20found%20that,traveled%20amounted%20to%201%2C518%20miles.)

The United Nation's [2021 State of Food and Agriculture report](https://www.fao.org/3/cb4476en/online/cb4476en.html) states that in over 45 nations, the closure of a single route could increase food travel times by 20%+

---

## 💡 **Proposed Solution**
🌐 [*https://thecityfarmers.org/*](https://thecityfarmers.org/)

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/Skh4ws0x6.png)


📝 *This is what we're building towards, the 10-year vision.
Vertical farming in solar glass greenhouses.* 

**The City Farmers** is the premier program of the Kenwood Training Center, a 501c3 non-profit headquartered in Chicago.

We are dedicated to empowering individuals, particularly those with criminal records and veterans, through comprehensive training in sustainable urban agriculture.  Our goal is to promote self-sufficiency and personal growth by equipping them with the skills to operate and own their own greenhouses.

Parallel to this, we champion vibrant neighborhoods. By transforming vacant city lots into commercial agricultural greenhouses, we contribute to the vitality and sustainability of urban communities.

Our finances are managed by the Public Health Institute of Metropolitan Chicago, another 501c3 non-profit, in return for 10% of all donations received.

---

## 🌟 **Opportunity**

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/rk9EuERea.jpg)

📝 *We have the opportunity today to get ahead of an exponential global trend.*
*Source: [Data Bridge Market Research](https://www.databridgemarketresearch.com/reports/global-urban-farming-market)*

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/HkDeetCe6.png)

📝 *"In 2022, food spending by U.S. consumers, businesses, and government entities totaled $2.39 trillion" - [Economic Research Service, U.S. Department of Agriculture](https://www.ers.usda.gov/data-products/ag-and-food-statistics-charting-the-essentials/food-prices-and-spending/#:~:text=U.S.%20food%20spending%20in%202020%20totaled%20%241.81%20trillion.,trillion%20in%202021%20to%20%241.34%20trillion%20in%202022.)*

Nouns is an engine for the development of public goods. Access to fresh, nutritionally rich foods is a key determinent of long term mental health and physical wellness. By reframing food as a public good, we have the potential to uplift the whole of society and proliferate the meme through the direct route to people's hearts: their stomachs.

### **Research & Develop Urban Agriculture** 
Kobe University's Graduate School of Agricultural Science in Japan has researched dry-fog aeroponics since 2011. When growing lettuce, this method uses 90-95% less water and 98% less land than traditional agriculture. We can build upon this research to include new crops and refine the method, in partnership with the [Illinois Institute of Technology's Institute of Food Safety & Health](https://www.ifsh.iit.edu/) and the United States Department of Agriculture, who are opening their first ever Urban Ag office in Chicago towards the end of this year and have $9 million of grants we qualify for.
### **Bring Ag Carbon Onchain** 
We're in conversation with developers focused on omnichain & web2 interopability to bring [agricultrual carbon data](https://cid-inc.com/plant-science-tools/leaf-area-measurement/ci-340-handheld-photosynthesis-system/) onchain. There are millions of dollars of government and private grants available for this R&D work.
### **Food as Medicine**
Public health agencies and providers are increasingly recognizing the role of food and nutrition in health outcomes. The Public Health Institute of Metropolitan Chicago has partnered with us and manages our finances. Their deep connections in the pubic health field place us in a strong position to secure grants for this work. 
### **Workforce Development** 
PHIMC also has deep connections with the Illinois Department of Justice and a commitment to restorative justice programs. It is our goal to leverage this to create a workorce development program for individuals with criminal records. We have a pilot location in mind next door to a Juvenile Detention Facility in Chicago.
### **Grassroots Community Empowerment**
By refining the methods and educating the people, Nouns stands to empower low-income, low-access neighborhoods to develop into thriving, sustainable communities by directly addressing their core issues: *health, local nutritious food, and equitable employment.*
### **Ultimate Proliferation**
Bringing Nouns into the grocery store, refigerator, and people's stomachs makes it a household brand, while living true to the founding principles of positive impact through public goods.


Our mission to make nutrious food a public good may be ambitious, however the impact that success would have across society makes it an obvious bet.

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/BkTtkJxb6.png)

# Let's make a short animated film to fund the Protocol Guild

[![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/BJuogvxb6.jpg)](https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/npgcssj0xy1xyid9utxob/Nouns_Pitch.mov?rlkey=z8cgbr02oza3e6wl1h3scv54z&dl=0)


## TL;DR

Let’s make a ~45s short animated film to celebrate [Protocol Guild's](https://protocol-guild.readthedocs.io/en/latest/#) work on Ethereum, release it as a droposal, and donate the proceeds of the mint to fund Ethereum core development. This prop requests $400k USDC to hire [The Line](https://www.thelineanimation.com/), a BAFTA-nominated animation studio to make this short film. 
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/Sy9sXPeZa.png)


## Why support Protocol Guild? 
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/S1yDWDxWa.jpg)

Nouns love public art and software, and Protocol Guild maintains the most important public software to us: Ethereum. We've demonstrated this in the past to the [tune of 500 ETH](https://www.nounsagora.com/proposals/108). Instead of continuing with direct donation, I'm proposing that we leverage our financial and creative resources to make film about PG, and release it as a mintable NFT whose proceeds go towards the Guild.

This is not only great for PG, but also affords us a unique opportunity to use nounish imagery, characters and themes in a piece of media that will widely seen in our prime demographic of humans who love and care for ethereum.

It's true that "donating" via a mintable film is more risky than giving money directly – but I think telling the story of Ethereum and Protocol Guild through the lens of Nouns is something we can uniquely do. Other DAOs like UNI and LIDO may be able to donate more due to their larger treasury – but none have the mission and mandate to fund creative endeavours like we do.

A successsful $400k investment in storytelling can have a **broader reach** than our previous $500ETH investment and drive far **more direct positive attention** to Nouns while at the same time providing major financial support to Protocol Guild. And we have evidence this can work, both from our [past](https://www.thisisnouns.wtf/) [successful](https://www.premiere.wtf/) droposals and the [Stand with crypto](https://zora.co/collect/eth:0x9d90669665607f08005cae4a7098143f554c59ef) mint.

## What's the story we're going to tell?

[![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/BJuogvxb6.jpg)](https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/npgcssj0xy1xyid9utxob/Nouns_Pitch.mov?rlkey=z8cgbr02oza3e6wl1h3scv54z&dl=0)

Please watch Bjorn, our director, tell you the story, settings, and characters in his voice. We're working with a draft story and visual references, and will be refining it all over time with input from the Nouns community. Our current draft story is something like this:

>This is a story set in a floating port town, which metaphorically represents the Ethereum ecosystem. Everyone is gathered to celebrate the return of the Protocol Guild, a group of adventurers bringing back innovations that will improve the town (metaphorically EIP-4844). The Nouns play host to these adventurers by inviting them to a big feast. We follow a young child who looks up to the Protocol Guild and follows them across their journey around town, in hope of meeting his heroes.

If you'd like to check out [the draft script](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1T1Gw8W74_9BR_o6ADetRxnyxza-SPR7lZdof9jTPslg/edit?usp=sharing) yourself!


## The world and its characters
You should definitely check out Bjorn's video explaining the world in his own words, but check these images for a preview! And feel free to [flip through the reference deck yourself!](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1NI_MTJSPafHsAi-W37BWFQeDsi-uBFQe/view?usp=sharing)

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/rJaijgagp.jpg)
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/BJ6jogpl6.jpg)
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/ryTijlpe6.jpg)
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/HkpjolTx6.jpg)
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/r16ssgpea.jpg)



## Who's making the film?

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/r1OnCNL1a.jpg)

We're working with The Line – a BAFTA-nominated animation studio whose work span across work for major brands and original animation. They've worked extensively with top tier artists and brands like [Gorillaz](https://www.thelineanimation.com/work/gorillaz), [Lil Nas X](https://www.thelineanimation.com/work/lilnasx-star-walkin), and [Marvel Studios](https://www.thelineanimation.com/work/hero-marvel-snap), and [Nickelodeon](https://www.thelineanimation.com/work/nickelodeon-vines). Our director will be Bjorn-Erik Aschim, who's also a studio co-founder.

I reached out to them not only because they worked on a [viral Chobani video about a solarpunk farm](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z-Ng5ZvrDm4) – which I think visually and emotively embodies the vision the aspiration of Nouns and Ethereum really well, but also because they are one of the best studios in the world, whose work is widely recognized in the creative industry.

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/H11spyae6.png)

## Funding & milestones
**Funding**

I'm requesting $400k USDC to fund this short animation. 100% of the amount goes to The Line to fund the development of the film. The funds will be released over 2 milestones: 1/2 upfront, and 1/2 upon completion.

Milestone payment will be held in an escrow multisig whose signers are the Agora team and will be disbursed to The Line upon milestone completion. In the unlikely event that the film cannot be completed, the remainder funds will be returned to the DAO.

Then, trent.eth from Protocol Guild will submit another proposal to the DAO to release the short film as a droposal with 70% of the proceeds going to Protocol Guild, 20% to Nouns treasury, and 10% to Agora. 


## What's Agora / Yitong's role in this?
I'm incredibly excited about more Nouns-produced short films released as Droposals, because there's a real flywheel here if we can demonstrate that Nouns can create super high quality short films that also have real mint value. 

It's why we're working on an [easy Droposals](https://www.nounsagora.com/proposals/346) creator at Agora, and I can think of no better film than one about Ethereum itself to demonstrate the power of Droposals.


## Timeline
Dates are approximate, and may change by a few days depending on exact timing of the candidate approval. During the process, Yitong will serve as liaison between The Line and the Nouns community to make sure we have the chance to provide feedback during each phase of production.

w/c 19th Oct - Proposal approved (PAYMENT MILESTONE 1 50%)
w/c 26th Oct - Creative Phase commences
w/c 10th Nov - Creative Phase Deck Approval
w/c 16 Nov - Pre-production commences
w/c 30th Nov - Edit Lock & Designs approval
w/c 21th Dec - Layout approve

# Propdates 2.0

*“What ever happened to Prop #123?”
“What was the most successful Nouns proposal?”
“Which proposals should we try to repeat?”
“Who are our most committed contributors?”*

[Propdates](https://updates.wtf) is here to answer these questions. With contracts built by Wilson, Propdates is the best way to keep up with Nouns proposals after they pass, and an entirely new design space within the greater Nouns ecosystem. We’ve never had any consistent, onchain way to keep track of contributors’ work, and no way to recommend regular updates. Down the line, one could imagine Propdates as an onchain oracle for proposal progress.

## PROGRESS SO FAR
I built the Propdates site and public graph, inspired by Krel’s [requests.wtf](http://requests.wtf). What started as a weekend experiment has grown into something much bigger: it’s clear that we’ve tapped into something special. In fact, Propdates has already become part of the pre-proposal conversation process - it is expected that a proposer regularly updates the DAO on their work. In just a few weeks, we already have had 17 unique posters, and more coming.

![](https://i.ibb.co/mt9nCgz/metrics.png)
![](https://i.ibb.co/CzXyQrg/other.png)

## LOOKING AHEAD
We’d like to move Propdates from an experiment to a fully-featured Nouns app and a key part of the ecosystem, on par with teams like Agora, Federation, Prop House. Our end goal is for Propdates to be a protocol any contract or app can plug into to determine a proposal’s success. It is clear that it could expand further than just Nouns.

We are asking for three months of funding (more on the team below). For these months, our priorities will be:
1.  Contract improvements to expand functionality  & data
	- New channels to post updates in: prop house entries, user channels, custom channels
	- Revamped admin system / permissions + “Super Admin” to unlock proposals where proposer is unresponsive
	- Explore contract to update/revoke streams based on a proposal's updates
2.  Improved editor, claiming and submitting UX
	- Easy image upload via Arweave or IPFS (and potentially expand as a public good for Nouns ecosystem)
	- In-app markdown editor and previews for better UX
3.  Farcaster integration for likes & comments on updates
4.  Open Editions to celebrate Completed Props

Our goals by January 31st, 2024 are:
-   150 proposals marked as completed
-   400 updates posted
-   30 weekly updates on average

Additionally, we want to encourage past proposals to share updates on their work, but recognize it’s often hard for contributors to track down their sponsoring proposers (pre-v3). We are requesting 0.05 ETH to send to each of the first 100 successful props (before prop #363) that posts a non-trivial update as an incentive to kickstart the protocol. At the time of writing there have been 225 successful proposals, so this would go a long way to getting all proposals marked as completed.

## TEAM

-   [martin](https://twitter.com/anquetil) worked on [Mogu](http://nouns.wtf/vote/321), [Explorer Grants](http://nouns.wtf/vote/178), [Hack Week](http://nouns.wtf/vote/253)
-   [onnnnnnnion](https://twitter.com/onnnnnnnion) (solidity) worked on [BLOCKS](https://mint.fun/zora/0x1F781d47cD59257D7AA1Bd7b2fbaB50D57AF8587), [onions renderer](https://twitter.com/onnnnnnnion/status/1639045062595170307), [PH Infinite Round Committee](https://prop.house/infinite/nouns-retro-grants)

## FUNDING
-   Team: 30 ETH for three months (via Stream)
-   Incentives: 5 ETH (100 * 0.05 ETH)
-   OpEx: 2 ETH
 
We commit to posting updates on [updates.wtf](https://updates.wtf) bi-weekly to keep the community updated on our progress. If we do not update, our stream can be canceled.

# The Giant Noggles: Australia's Next Iconic Tourist Attraction (phase 1)

## **Preface**

Let me just preface this with the fact that I am open to and I welcome any suggestions, feedback, changes and input. I would very much appreciate some if you have a different vision for this. None of this is set in stone per se and will utilise the edit functionality if there needs to be changes.

---

## **Introduction**

The Allure of the Big Things: Australia, with its vast landscapes and vibrant cities, has a tradition of celebrating the unique, exemplified by the nation's fondness for "big things." With the inception dating back to "Ploddy" the dinosaur in the 1960s, these colossal attractions have woven themselves into the country's cultural fabric. "The Giant Noggles" aims to be the next in this esteemed lineage, offering an experience that is not just visual, but interactive and deeply engaging.

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/H1gnFeNZ6.png)

---

## **Market Analysis**

Australia's "big things" have always been more than just roadside attractions; they've been symbolic landmarks, driving tourism and community engagement.

As of this year, there are 150+ "big things" scattered across Australia. I personally have visited many of them since a kid, but moreso now with my own young kids... they are absolutely obsessed with the big things.
`[video proof - will be added once I can track noggles on my kid's face]`

Some of these icons, like the Big Banana in Coffs Harbour, are known to draw hundreds of thousands of visitors each year. The Big Banana, in particular, underwent several expansions over the years due to its popularity, transforming from a mere oversized fruit to a park with rides, tours, and a shopping precinct. It's now reported to be generating revenue of $12 million (AUD) annually.

Revenue for these attractions can vary based on location, accessibility, and amenities. For instance, the Big Merino souvenir shop is reported to have annual sales in the six figure range, even without considering auxiliary revenue streams like cafes or tour services nearby.

The constant evolution of these attractions, coupled with their undying popularity, signals a thriving market with a penchant for the novel and the nostalgic. I believe The Giant Noggles, with its modern interactive approach, can carve its own niche in this market, attracting both domestic and international tourists. Additionally, it is likely to get nationwide news coverage.

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/BJI_5eEba.png)

---

## **Suitability To The Task**

I have already played a part in manufacturing the largest noggles in the world, which are currently installed at Rusutsu Resort in Hokkaido, Japan. They measure 9x3m and gained the excited attention of the nouniverse and beyond, and will continue to be embedded in the experience of the visitors to Rusutsu for potentially years to come. They will be highly visible during the upcoming Winter while placed in the middle of one of the busiest points in the resort!

Ever since we had those installed though, I have been dreaming up how to go bigger! This time around, I would like to retain the full aesthetic with the black and white lenses, while making them much, much bigger. They will likely be created using structural beams to achieve max strength and size. Making them visible from the highway while driving is the dream.

I'm Australian, currently living in Australia and I am close enough to be able to attend potential sites. Plus I understand the culture deeply and have the ability to talk to all parties needed with clarity to organise such an endeavour.

---

## **Location & Accessibility**

### **Prime Visibility**:
The target location is along Australia's bustling east coast highway, the M1 between Sydney and Gold Coast to ensure The Giant Noggles become an unmissable landmark. Such strategic positioning not only maximizes visibility to the huge amount of traffic that travles this highway year round, but also facilitates easy access for travelers and tourists. Clear signages will be crucial to guide visitors, making their approach and journey hassle-free. With the right location, it could bode well for getting Tesla superchargers installed on site to help extend their network too.

### **Land Considerations**:
While I haven't secured land or entered into formal discussions, this proposal seeks to facilitate a research phase. This initial phase will help gauge potential costs associated with land acquisition or leasing. A careful analysis will be conducted to determine the best approach, be it a permanent purchase for the attraction's longevity or a lease agreement to test the waters.

### **Local/Rural Community**:
The location could be a key element in engaging the local community and empowering them with local IRL jobs as well as knowledge of and access to the nouns ecosystem. There's potential for ecotourism integration as well.

---

## **Preliminary Research Proposal (Phase 1)**:
This phase 1 mission aims to lay the foundation by:

1. Scouting potential locations along the east coast highway.
2. Estimating costs associated with land acquisition or lease.
3. Gauging infrastructure and development costs for the three levels of the Giant Noggles attraction outlined below.

This preliminary research ensures a structured and informed approach to the larger vision, helping to anticipate challenges and allocate resources effectively.

---

## **Proposal Funding Levels (Phase 2)**

With such an extensive concept, there's a lot of ideas and room for growth. I foresee initial planning around the following 3 levels to accommodate the funding commitment/sentiment from the DAO when a full proposal candidate is presented in phase 2. These levels are an initial indication and are subject to change in structure as the research phase progresses. I am totally open to feedback and suggestions too.

### **Level 1: Minimal Viable Product (MVP)**
- **The Giant Noggles Structure**: A towering, monumental, eye-catching centerpiece that will serve as the primary attraction and memory-maker.
  
- **Oversized Noggles Props**: Interactive, freestanding noggles for visitors to enact the playful illusion of wearing them.

- **Automated Vending Machines**: Stocked with exclusive nounish merchandise, from wearables to collectibles. These machines not only offer visitors tangible memories but also support creators and manufacturers in the ecosystem while requiring minimal maintenance.

- **Self-Serve Photo Stations**: Areas furnished with panels featuring face holes, set against vibrant and creative backdrops, supported by permanent stands for phones/cameras for those easy timer shots.

- **Curated Art & Info Displays**: Artistic displays and panels introducing visitors to the nounish aesthetic and noteworthy contributors in the ecosystem.

### **Level 2: Enhanced Experience**
- **Nounish Museum & Retail Store**: A deeper dive into the nounish world, offering merchandise and a historical look at its evolution.
  
- **Food offerings**: Nounish-themed foods, enhancing the immersive experience for visitors.
  
- **Regular Contests & Events**: Organized activities to foster community engagement and ensure repeat visits.

- **Domain-Specific Nounish Communities Sections**: Focusing on various sub-communities within the larger nounish culture.

- **Interactive Learning Stations**: Digital screens elaborating on the history and significance of noggles.

- **Signage & Directional Guides**: Embedding nouns into the very fabric of the space for a holistic experience.

### **Level 3: Stretch Goals**
- **Art Gallery & Arcade**: Spaces dedicated to the visual appreciation of noggles-related art and playful engagement through interactive games.

- **Co-working Spaces & Events Area**: Multi-purpose spaces catering to the diverse needs of visitors, from professionals seeking a work spot to groups wanting event venues.

- **Essential Amenities**: Comprehensive facilities including bathrooms and showers for the convenience of visitors.

- **Climbing Experience Inside Noggles**: An adventurous add-on to make the primary structure itself a point of engagement.

- **Electric Car Charging Station**: A nod to the future with a Tesla Supercharger setup. Tesla provides these as long as your location meets their criteria, so installation is at their discretion.

---

## **Funding & Future**

I am adopting a two-phase approach:

- **Phase 1**: This initial phase focuses on comprehensive planning and research to lay the groundwork for a detailed and accurate candidate proposal in the future.

    I estimate around 50-100 hours will be spent gathering information. It's very likely that I'll need to travel to some locations to meet with land owners, real estate, local councils and businesses across potential locations - around 7-12hrs of driving in some cases.

    With all this in mind, I kindly request 7 ETH to cover costs for phase 1.
  
- **Phase 2**: Informed by the findings of Phase 1, this phase presents a detailed financial proposal. It will detail the costs for the MVP and offer insight into the potential expansion costs for the enhanced experience and stretch goals, while also presenting projected revenue streams and models for each.

This strategy ensures a minimal upfront investment in research, paving the way for a well-informed MVP proposal. By presenting the DAO with clear options and pricing in the next phase, there will be somewhat of a multiple choice on the candidate proposal where I will seek feedback from voters until support is clear and it gains a sponsor. We can all to decide together what the best plan of attack would be with the information at hand.

As the attraction garners increased attention and popularity, this vision extends beyond the MVP. Subsequent expansions are poised to transform The Giant Noggles from a novel tourist attraction into a lucrative venture. There's room for advertising, retail, workshops, events and even accommodation.

---

## **Conclusion**
**The Giant Noggles isn't just a structure; it's a narrative, an experience, a legacy in the making. I invite nouners to be part of this visionary journey, a chance to be etched in Australia's vibrant tourism tapestry.**

Thank you for your time and consideration!

# Require noun age to fork (requesting feedback)

We are proposing to change the forking mechanism by requiring a minimum age for any noun that wishes to fork. For example, only nouns that are at least 100 “days” old are allowed to fork.

The goal of this change is to mitigate some of the current arbitrage happening, where certain actors buy nouns on the auction only to fork with them as soon as possible. By only allowing aged nouns to fork, we are inviting more long term players to participate in the auction.

Suggested spec:
* Age will be counted by noun IDs. e.g. if the currently auctioned noun is 876, then noun #700 has age 176 days.
* The required age for forking will be a parameter configurable by the DAO, zero at first.
* The functions `escrowToFork` and `joinFork` will check for this requirement.

If we see significant support for this change we will update this proposal to include funding for an audit of this change.

# Bounce Nouns Across the Metaverse

# TL;DR

The Nouns community has created high quality libraries of Nouns artwork and assets that are incredibly all in the public domain. These are fantastic resources for developers and designers, but can be difficult for non-technical audiences to use. We want to bring accessibility and utility of Nouns to **everyone** by providing a simple, seamless way to use Nouns avatars and art across the best digital platforms and spaces. 

![nounsWave2.gif](https://baunsu.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/nouns/nounsWave2.gif)

![noun2Mona.gif](https://baunsu.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/nouns/noun2Mona.gif)

![nounsLens.gif](https://baunsu.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/nouns/nounsLens.gif)

## Proposal brief
With the Bounce platform, we want to bridge the Nouniverse and the open Metaverse:

- make current and future Nouns easily to use, seamlessly, across digital platforms ⇒ **everyone** can experience and enjoy Nouns, forever
- bring exposure in more spaces to new audiences, both web3 and web2 ⇒ **grow** Nouns community
- build and open and extensible system with a Bounce API & SDK ⇒ **empower** community to innovate and build on top of Bounce

## Budget

We’re asking for 15 ETH to onboard Nouns onto Bounce and enable cross-world experiences.
The budget includes:

- Build a Nouns X Bounce community microsite
- Cost of asset onboarding and processing all existing and future Nouns for the following platforms:
    - VRChat
    - Mona
    - Snap
    - Instagram
- Making Bounce connections free for everyone, across all spaces, forever
- Developing new platform integrations for spaces the Nouns community is excited about

# Proposal

Bounce is a new cross-world digital asset platform that makes it easy for fans and collectors to embody their avatars in immersive web2 and web3 platforms, and connect with their communities. Our goal is to empower avatar communities to embody their avatars, express themselves and come together in more immersive and engaging ways.

This proposal is to onboard Nouns onto Bounce as an early partner, making Nouns enjoyable by the community across a range of digital spaces, including social, gaming and metaverse platforms

## How Bounce benefits the Nouns community

- Easily enjoy Nouns as avatars, sticker packs, face filters and more across social, gaming and metaverse platforms
- Expand the community and reach of the Nouns brand and content across digital spaces
- Access more platforms and experiences as they roll out, new spaces are available to all Nouns, new and existing
- Support other DAO projects with public API and SDK that make “bouncing” a seamless and hassle-free process
- Bounce Tags support phygital projects with easy onboarding and allocated stock
- Nouns on Bounce will be free for everyone, forever

## Deliverables

The project is estimated at 1.5 to 2 months and will include:

- **A unique Bounce X Nouns microsite** where the community can go to bounce across spaces and enjoy exclusive content. This site also acts as a landing page for special Nouns events and activations across spaces. (EXAMPLE MOCKUP BELOW)
    
    ![nounsMicrositeMockup.jpg](https://baunsu.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/nouns/nounsMicrositeMockup.jpg)
    
- **Cross platform digital avatars** that can be used as in-space characters, face lenses and filters, sticker packs and more across a range of platforms.
    
    Platforms include:
    
  - VR Chat
    
    ![nounsWave1.gif](https://baunsu.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/nouns/nounsWave1.gif)
    
    ![nounsWave2.gif](https://baunsu.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/nouns/nounsWave2.gif)
    
    ![nounsWave3.gif](https://baunsu.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/nouns/nounsWave3.gif)
    
  - Mona
    
    ![noun1Mona.gif](https://baunsu.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/nouns/noun1Mona.gif)
    
    ![noun2Mona.gif](https://baunsu.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/nouns/noun2Mona.gif)
    
    ![noun3Mona.gif](https://baunsu.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/nouns/noun3Mona.gif)
    
  - AR Filters: (ROUGH PROTOTYPE BELOW)
    - Snap
    - Instagram
    
    ![nounsLens.gif](https://baunsu.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/nouns/nounsLens.gif)
    
    ![nounsLensCalculator.gif](https://baunsu.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/nouns/nounsLensCalculator.gif)
    
    ![nounsLensCoin.gif](https://baunsu.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/nouns/nounsLensCoin.gif)
    
- More spaces the community is excited about
- **Public API, SDK and docs** that can be used by other DAO projects to give utility to digital assets and make bouncing a hassle free integration.
- **Free access to everyone, across all spaces, forever**

We also commit to posting frequent updates on https://www.updates.wtf/ to keep the community informed on progress and updates, both as the proposal is developed, and as future platforms and experiences are rolled out and made available.

# Future proposals

## Bounce X Nouniverse events and community activations

We think the best way to experience bounce as a community is through special events, gatherings and activations. Our collab with the Wassies community was made so much more exciting by their VR Chat Among Us and Zombie Survival (https://twitter.com/ByWassiesEvents)

As Nouns is decentralized, we’d like to put forward future proposals to design, plan, coordinate and market events and games across platforms.

## Bounce Tags for DAO and community projects

Bounce Tags, our secure chain-linked NFC tags, are integrated into the Bounce ecosystem and make bouncing from a physical collectible to digital spaces a quick and seamless experience. Many DAO proposals are dedicated to crafting both amazing new Nouns physical products (Noggle Changers, NounsDAO x Pudgy Penguins toys, NOUNISH FRIENDS mini-figures, etc), and these could all be linked using tags (think tapping your Nouns glasses and bouncing to Nouns AR filters and more). We would like to put forward a future proposal to provide tags for community projects (as part of their proposals) that will be custom designed, programmed and integrated with our support. 

# Who we are

## About Bounce

Bounce is a new cross-world avatar platform that makes it easy for fans and collectors to embody their avatars in immersive web2 and web3 platforms, and connect with their communities. We automate all platform-specific integrations, such as coding, rigging, file conversions and API & SDK connections, making it simple to use a unique physical or digital collectible (such as NFTs, sneakers, trading cards and more), generated based on unique traits, as an avatar across platforms. Our Bounce Tag uses active encryption NFC to ensure a secure and permanent link between authentic physical goods and their digital counterparts.

- Learn more about Bounce - [letsbounce.gg](http://www.letsbounce.gg/)

## Bounce partnerships with avatar communities

A great example of how Bounce can help engage and activate a web3 community is our recent partnership with Wassies. Bounce allows the Wassies community to enjoy their fridge-dwelling creatures in new ways, from face filters on Snap and Instagram, to custom avatars on VR Chat, and create unique HD renders of their Wassie. 

Wassies on Bounce can be viewed by everyone, holders can bounce their held ones, and CC0 Wassies are available for everyone to bounce.

Response from the Wassies community has been great, and the team has created a series of engaging events on Twitter and VR Chat that brought together fans and holders to play games, show off their unique renders and wassify their socials.

# Spec The 🔥 To Eliminate The Put (Requesting Feedback) 

I am proposing parameters to the current proposed implementation of [The Burn](https://w.mirror.xyz/AmHOzH-FQZVO3IhGXHSvCRxRSf2MO6VCZdmMwNEIyKE). I am putting this up to raise awareness among voters, stimulate the conversation, and listen to feedback. 

I will break this down into two sections: a TL;DR for people with a technical background, and a further breakdown to help the general community understand the issue at hand - why I believe the current proposed burn mechanism specs do not eliminate the intrinsic value arbitrage opportunity, and most importantly what can be done to resolve this! 

**TL;DR: I am proposing to change the timeframe that ‘burns’ could potentially occur from 90 days to a fork threshold period of N days.** There are 69 Nouns in Fork 1 - this would bring new circulating supply down to 332 - meaning if all new auction bids are from RFV traders it would take 33 days to trigger a new fork (assuming zero are sold on secondary market below BV). If we keep the proposed 90 days there could be potentially 3+ more rounds of forks before a burn is executed. 

**I am proposing that we change from auction average value to the lowest settlement price within the previous N days (which I am calling fork threshold period).** In order to completely remove the intrinsic value arbitrage opportunity we have to set it to zero. This is done by having the lowest auction price within the previous N days set as the new strike price. If the lowest auction price is above book value then default to book value (as BV would be the redemption value if forked & RQ). These parameters would ensure protection for the DAO when auction prices trend below BV. 

**I am proposing that we do not build this design into the protocol and first test with a manual solution I have described below.** I believe that once we eliminate the intrinsic value arbitrage opportunity completely, this will no longer be an issue to plague the DAO, therefore there is no need to make protocol changes which are time and cost intensive. 

—-----------------------------

**Issue At Hand:** Currently we are faced with an issue that Nouns BV (book value) is higher than the current market demand, therefore creating an intrinsic value arbitrage opportunity to bid in the auction below BV, then Fork & RQ (Rage Quit) a pro rata share of the treasury and capturing a RFV (risk free value) trade. There have been numerous solutions proposed on how to resolve this issue such as burning excess eth, ‘forced spending’, vesting newly minted nouns etc. The issue is, the current proposed solutions do not eliminate the intrinsic value arbitrage opportunity or generate organic market demand for auctions to trade above book value. 

Below I have created a simulation of a Fork Threshold Period that I have set to 40 days, this means it would take 40 days of auctions to mint enough new Nouns to trigger a fork. This includes mock data of potential auction prices and prop spending following current trends of auction prices below book value. 

![Simulation 1](https://imageupload.io/ib/YQWdq9tplvxq467_1697265039.png)


First we will review this simulation with the current proposed burn structure:

![Current Burn Specs](https://imageupload.io/ib/DvM0rTXmI9JzdIt_1697265039.png)

With this current proposed burn structure we would have to quickly spend or burn 500.58 eth.

**Why This Solution Does Not Eliminate The Arb Opportunity:** We are using an average vs the lowest auction price, therefore there is incentive for the RFV traders to keep the auction average below BV with a large spread. After fork 0 we saw auction prices range from 16-33. Therefore if we assume in the above simulation that the people who bought below are RFV traders, there would be an additional 720.36eth leaving the treasury in the next fork - of which 51.18eth is RFV (Risk Free Value). At this rate we would still be losing eth to arbitrage trades, and between the ‘burn’ & fork we would see 1220.94 eth leaving the treasury. Rinse and repeat every fork threshold until we have organic market demand where all auction prices are consistently above BV. 

—-----------------------------

Next we will review a simulation of my proposed parameters which involves taking the lowest auction price within the last N days (fork threshold). Please note, the first simulation is going to be the most extreme, after this though the arb opportunity is completely closed. This means the actions moving forward of burn, spend or dilute would be much less volatile. 
 
![Proposed Burn Specs](https://imageupload.io/ib/vjRAATPpIQ7smrh_1697265038.png)

From this data you can see that we would be taking the lowest auction price of the last N days (fork threshold period) which becomes the new book value price. Ending BV is 32.47 and we would need to reduce this to match the lowest auction price of 25.7…. There are three options on how we can do this: Burn. Spend. Dilute. 

Burning will be done via sending eth to: 0x000000000000000000000000000000000000dEaD spend would send money to Prop House to be used for future funding of props and builders (as an example), dilute would be done by releasing Nouns into a rewards wallet - still controlled by the DAO, but out of the treasury therefore counted towards circulating supply. 

From the example above the options for this simulation would be to Burn 2945.28 eth, Spend 2945.28 eth by sending it to Prop House for future use, or Dilute by releasing 120 Nouns to a rewards wallet for future distribution. 

**What Can Be Done To Resolve This:** I do not believe any of these choices should be made as a default decision built into the protocol. I believe the community should be presented the data from each fork threshold period and be allowed to make an informed decision on which option they would prefer to execute. The eth can be transferred to an escrow contract so it is out of the treasury and not calculated towards BV while the DAO votes to Burn. Spend. Dilute - If dilution is the option voted on by the DAO, the escrowed eth will be returned to the Treasury after Treasury Nouns are transferred to the rewards wallet. This decision should be executed within N days (I propose 7 as that aligns with the current proposal voting period). 

I am proposing to create a dashboard that will display the following stats and will also serve as a sentiment voting platform for Nouns token holders: 

![Voting Dashboard](https://imageupload.io/ib/LHQ2bhseBWmVvpI_1697314351.png)

During the fork threshold period based on the data provided DAO members can come to vote on which option they would like to choose: Burn. Spend. Dilute. This vote will be done via snapshot and at the end of the fork threshold the results will display the vote, and a community member can put an onchain proposal to execute the collective decision. I believe this will increase governance participation - allow community members to feel they have a say in which option is being chosen, and also allow for decision making based on accurate information vs estimations. 

As I mentioned above the first simulation will be the most extreme and volatile. Here is a simulation where auction prices have a tighter window as we trend towards our goal of auction prices = or > BV. 

![Simulation 2](https://imageupload.io/ib/L7AZoT785zSCeqe_1697314351.png)

For simulation 2 with my proposed specs we have an ending BV of 15.84 and the lowest auction price of 15.42. This means we would be presented with the options of burning 350.85 eth, spending 350.85 eth or releasing 30 Nouns into the rewards wallet. 

![Proposed Burn Specs](https://imageupload.io/ib/9yylEzvvYRaXKcv_1697314351.png)

As you can see this is less volatile of a situation vs simulation 1. Once the RFV traders know that there is no longer an intrinsic arb opportunity we should see Nouns find its true market value, and only people bidding and buying into the project who have an aligned vision. 

Auction prices are unknown and game-able if the arb opportunity is still open. This means that even if the idea of the DAO was to spend down the treasury quickly, there would not be accurate data available to make decisions quick enough (as the final numbers are not calculated ‘until it's too late’). Meaning we will not know the true number to burn, spend or dilute until the final days of the 90 day period, and we currently have a 7 day voting period for proposals to pass or fail. If the RFV traders see large props in the pipeline they will adjust their auction bids based on that information. This will result in a constant cat and mouse game until we generate organic market demand for the auction above book value. 

**Disadvantages To Closing Arb Opportunity:** While I personally believe this is the most effective solution to resolve our current issue, I do recognize that there are disadvantages to closing the arb opportunity completely which include the following: 
- **Market Discovery of True Book Value** - This means that we would be faced with volatility during the price discovery phase, are we prepared to see a 12-15 eth Noun during these current market conditions?
- **Decreased Auction Participation** - Currently ~85% of auction bids are from RFV traders, if the arb opportunity is closed we may see a decrease in auction activity until we generate more organic market demand
- **Intrinsic vs Extrinsic Arb Opportunity** - The issue we are currently dealing with involves the intrinsic arb opportunity….. If we remove this we will see traders with more advanced financial strategies come into play, which would involve an extrinsic arb opportunity when auction prices = or > BV (there is a resolution to this issue which can be proposed as a phase 2 as the intrinsic arb is taken care of first)

I have ran other simulations with different auction price & prop spending scenarios and can share with anyone interested.

# The Noun Pulse

# The Noun Pulse

*“Is Nouns activity growing?” “Who is helping increase engagement and spreading the meme?” “Which proposals are driving growth?” “What’s our spend rate?” “How many builders are contributing to the Nouns ecosystem?” “Are the amount of proposal candidates increasing?”*

## **TL;DR**

We aim to create a single-purpose website where Nouns activity metrics are published. It will integrate activity across social channels and highlight which Nouns, advocates, and proposals have best supported the Noun’s meme propagation. Our creative motto is: *Track Memes, Not People.*

As a starting point, this proposal focuses on [1] onchain activity (supported by the Nouns subgraph), [2] a single social media source (Farcaster), and [3] a limited set of metrics — such as proposal submissions, votes, comments, casts, and engagement. Opportunistically, we will incorporate additional sources and expand the set of metrics.

## Background

As of the moment, the Nouns’ community and audience members produce a wide variety of data. Over time, more data is likely to migrate onchain (e.g. similar to vote comments today) and data will be produced across even more digital localities. The *United World of Nouns* will have a wide-ranging data footprint. Combining data across these localities can become a powerful tool for proposal development and decision-making.

However, as @Krel mentioned in their [Request for Proposers](https://www.notion.so/94dadff999ac493b9902aa002e4b296e?pvs=21):

**“Nouns DAO does not have a reliable way to measure ‘growth’ or ‘success’. Its not clear what should be measured, or what growth in the context of Nouns even means.”**

This project will create an initial repository of activity growth combining onchain and offchain data. We are long overdue to experiment on this front!

## Scope

The metrics tracker will be in the form of a single-purpose web application.

To begin, we will include onchain data available in the Nouns Subgraph and a single social media channel: Farcaster. We will publish a selection of core metrics that provide clarity to Noun holders the wider community. In addition, we will include a graph (Activity Momentum) and leaderboard (The Race) showing “drivers” of Noun activity.

Most importantly, the underlying data pool will serve a first step towards a data-driven Nouns culture, which community members and potential builders can use to find opportunities for proposal submissions.

Success of this project will be measured based on web application usage (unique visitors), proposal references (e.g. This project will increase X metric supporting Noun activity growth), and data pool connections (e.g. external usage of the database).

As a stretch goal, we will look to expand the data sources, for example including key derivative NFT projects (LilNouns) and other dominant social spaces (Discord, X, Lens).

## Product Components

### The Noun Pulse

Whenever we want to test our internet speed, we can easily go to a speed test website. If we want to see how our activity on X (formerly Twitter), we can go to profile analytics. **Where do we go to check how the Nouns ecosystem is growing?** We go to *The Noun Pulse.*

The Pulse is a single purpose website showcasing onchain and offchain activity metrics. This includes public conversations related to the *United World of Nouns.* The main graph, which we are currently calling *“Activity Momentum”* will showcase daily activity growth, a proxy for the Noun meme adoption and mind-share online.

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/BJ_mHgn-6.png)

Our data analytics approach will combine methodologies from (1) traditional media broadcasting (e.g. combining data like number of views, replies, likes, proposal submissions, unique voters, etc.) and (2) materials science and engineering (read more about how engineers develop [material selection indexes here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Material_selection))

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/SJldre3Za.png)

Data will be synchronized in real-time directly from the Nouns’ Subgraph and Farcaster to an SQL database. The sync mechanism will be architected in a uniform adapter interface for easier future integration with other onchain data and offchain sources, such as Twitter, Discourse, Discord, Telegram, DeSo, and Lens.

### The Great Nouns Race

In addition, the website will include an activity leader table. However, we want to be unlike traditional races which are solely based on unique identities. While social media analytics ask questions such as: who are the top casters in the Farcaster Nouns Channel?, we want the leaderboard to show which are ***the top memetic sources of Nouns activity***.

Our ambition is to be able to say: The Burn proposal is driving the most engagement, or Noun40 is the most popular Noun. In other words, we want to have a *Meme Race. **Can we create a leaderboard of memes, instead of people?***

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/S1_i8xnbp.png)

Through this design, Nouns would be able to identify the memetic drivers of growth. To start, we would look to rank discussions around specific Noun personas (e.g. which Noun is most popular), and look to extend this to include popular proposals and initiatives.

### Meme Activity Database (a.k.a. The MAD)

In addition to the main activity index and the leaderboard, the product’s underlying data model will be available for others to query and contribute to. That way, others can embed the index into their own Noun interfaces. Anyone should be able to get clean and reliable **meme-data-as-a-service** to support a diversity of Noun initiatives. Imagine a world where active proposals have conversation hype trackers, or ongoing projects can easily see total impressions across social media channels

Web API interface will be available publicly in the form of parametrizable JSON endpoints used by both The Great Nouns Race and The Nouns Pulse. The data will be distributed per specific sources (onchain Nouns, Farcaster, and others) as well as in aggregated form to enable the development of tools such as alerts and bots.

## Product Roadmap

1. Phase 1: Confirm data ETL operational design, create “Meme Activity Database” and publish MVP Pulse Website for testing (2-3 weeks)
2. Phase 2: Iterate on the website and create “The Great Nouns Race” (2-3 weeks)
3. Phase 3: Incorporate community feedback, address bugs and publish database (2-3 weeks)

## An Ambitious Vision

This project aims to uncover what “Nouns-Native” analytics could look like, and what data infrastructure is necessary to feed this analytics into the broader Nouns governance and participation process.

We’ve already intuited that we want to ***Track*** ***Memes, Not People*** — and we’re certain there will be other innovations along the way. After all, we need to address challenges in crossing the web3-to-web2 data pipeline chasm. Is it possible? We think so.

Nouns is a place for ambitious ideas, and we are an ambitious team.

## Team

This project will be led and executed by Rafa Fernandez (Farcaster: @rafa) and Rafi Gutkowski (Farcaster: @rafi). 

- Rafa Fernandez is a community architect with a focus on building [Digital Public Utilities](https://www.notion.so/General-Networks-e4615b9b52294f8bab34a82b47023d11?pvs=21). He has decade of experience in corporate analytics and studied materials-science and engineering. He is the founder of Folklore (Folklore.Institute), a community that curates and commissions research on digital cultures. Most recently, he was part of the Summer of Protocols research program looking at [online swarms](https://www.notion.so/41c114211ac045f087c44c16bd993748?pvs=21). Previous to the program he worked at Mirror where he worked in creator partnerships and community development.
- Rafi Gutkowski is a software engineer and data scientist ([libred.org](https://libred.org/), [LinkedIn](http://linkedin.com/in/rgutkowski)). He started mining bitcoin in 2015 but only after exiting from his recent startup, did he double down on web3. Since then Rafi has been working on sementic analysis of decentralized social graphs, as well as creating web3-web2 bridges, such as Folklore’s web3-signature to feed [broadcast applet](https://www.notion.so/Folklore-5d34757913064064b87119c4593eda74?pvs=21).

## Funding

We are requesting 25 ETH to fund this project over approximately 10 weeks.

## Our Commitments

- We commit to posting updates on [updates.wtf](https://updates.wtf/) with sprint plan and outcomes.
- We commit to executing this work as an open-source project, such that other onchain communities and organizations can benefit.

This proposal was built based on the Basic Nouns Proposal Template, built by Rafa and available here: https://hackmd.io/@rafathebuilder/BkPAmHZbp

# Real World Nouns Asset Purchase

NounsDAO is among one of the most prominent communities and ecosystems in web3. For the last couple years, Nouns has led the charge on a new way for projects and ideas to get funded. Over this time, the vast majority of funding was issued with few strings attached or promise of financial returns - instead, focusing on funding things the community wants to see happen in the world. 

This proposal is an experiment to break ground on a new kind of proposal: one that has the potential to provide perks to Nouns holders, and that has the potential to generate financial returns on deployed capital to ultimately increase demand for Nouns NFTs. 

**Some background on Venture Club**

Venture Club is a web2.5 project that has been building legal infrastructure to democratize capital formation over the last 1.5 years. Our core focus is on taking offchain assets (such as equity, SAFEs, SAFTs, Income sharing agreements, real estate, etc), and moving them compliantly onchain as NFTs, in different UIs. The NFTs created are DeFi compatible between KYCd addresses and allow-listed smart contracts. 

You can see some of the assets we’ve minted onchain [here](https://opensea.io/collection/venture-club).

Our proposal is a proof of concept, to demonstrate the ability of Nouns DAOs to participate in the purchase of traditional real world assets. We believe this option will open up new use cases for NounsDAOs, which have not yet been possible before.

**Why should you care?**

Having a clear and tested process to acquire “real world” assets has the potential to benefit current and future Nouns members. The main reasons why this should be of interest are:

1. Provide perks to members. For example, a piece of real estate could be purchased, and access could be given to Nouns members. Or rental income could be shared with Nouns members. Having access to these sort of assets most definitely helps propagate the Nouns meme, while simultaneously providing a very tangible benefit. 
2. Provide Nouns holders a means to benefit financially from teams and startups they support via the DAO.

**A Proof of Concept**

This proposal is a proof of concept (POC), to demonstrate that 1. NounsDAO can deploy capital to purchase an offchain asset; and that 2. ownership of this offchain asset can be claimed compliantly by its NounsDAO members. *This POC aims to demonstrate this concept via the purchase of an ownership stake in Venture Club, who has built the technology to make these offchain purchases possible.*

Our hope is that this model can be used in the future by NounsDAO to invest and acquire a variety of new asset classes which has not been possible until now (to our knowledge, a few projects have tried, but none have been able to provide a clear / compliant path forward). 

By proving this model out, it may even be possible that we see an increased demand for Nouns NFTs from speculators looking for exposure to assets and opportunities only available to this community. 

The end result is a NounsDAO with **an increased number of options** in front of it. Options to engage, options to reward, options to monetize and attract - in order to create a more desirable community to be a part of. 

**Our proposal**

- We are asking the NounsDAO community to make a strategic 50 ETH investment in Venture Club (via a SAFE investment agreement).
- Ownership in the investment will be split between all Nouns members who claim their personal ownership in the SAFE via the Venture Club app.
- As a US based company focused on tokenization of securities, Venture Club takes compliance seriously. Only KYCd individuals will be able to claim ownership in the SAFE. In addition, unaccredited US investors will not be able to participate. For individuals who don’t meet these criteria, they will be able to sell their right to claim to someone else who can claim, ensuring everyone can benefit from this process.
- As part of the Venture Club tokenization process, it is possible to set carry fee (currently 1%), as well as royalty fees (currently 5%) on secondary sales of NFTs. In order to incentivize the sponsoring of this proposal, fees arising from this proposal will be shared equally between Venture Club and those who sponsor this proposal.

**Milestones and next steps / sequence of events**

- Once this proposal is approved, a deal page will be published on Venture Club
- A Discord channel will be created in the Venture Club Discord to provide any support
- Nouns holders will be able to access the opportunity on our app, and mint their respective share of the SAFE contract via an NFT
- Once this proof of concept is complete, we would like to work with other teams looking to provide tangible benefits to Nouns holders.

**Some additional information**

- Some of our investors: [Gabby](https://twitter.com/gabusch) (Founder of YGG), [Timour](https://twitter.com/timourxyz) (Seed Club), [MetaCartel Ventures](https://metacartel.xyz/) (first venture dao in web3), Evgeny (founder of [Re7](https://www.re7.capital/)), Ben Middleton (founding partner at [Ascensive Assets](https://ascensiveassets.com/)), [Cultur3 Capital](https://cultur3.capital/) (web3 focused fund), among others
- Our [slide deck](https://cloudfiles.to/yw9rM7pi48O) (pw:Seed23)
- Our app: [app.ventureclub.club](http://app.ventureclub.club) (note, we’ve created a group for Nouns which you can join on the Network tab. Once you join this group, you’ll be able to see a live deal)
- Read more about our team [here](https://www.notion.so/d99b16167b8e475b89d4763e1edee999?pvs=21).

# Nouns Mechanical Keyboard [Revised]

![teaser_mk_new.png](https://github.com/profishional/nmk_files/blob/main/teaser_mk_new.png?raw=true)

[Real design will be done by a top-tier designer once he can start on the project]

---

### Revisions from [#266](https://nouns.wtf/vote/266):
- USDC denomination throughout the proposal and budget. Approximately 35% budget reduction by changing manufacturing approach, reducing marketing and team budget.
- Primarily manufacturing a Keycap set with an optional full keyboard. Also separating MK DAO and Physical NFT experiments for the next iteration.
- Simplified overall plan, shortened text, better FAQ, and detailed costing spreadsheet linked below.

[**Positive feedback from the previous proposal**](https://www.nounsagora.com/proposals/266):
- Community Alignment: A shared belief that the mechanical keyboard and Nouns communities have synergies, both being passionate and vibrant.
- Artistic Value: Recognition that mechanical keyboards are not just tools but are viewed as curated works of art by enthusiasts.
- Detailed Proposal: Depth and informativeness of the proposal including the visual concepts. Also, confidence in the team's ability given their experiences.

---
---

### TL;DR:
- Nouns-themed keycap set by a top-tier designer (not just glasses seen in the illustration) to introduce Nouns to an enthusiastic subculture of gamers, developers, collectors, and typists.
- 75K for Approx. 700 keycap sets or 275 full keyboards (keycap set + case), or a combination between those two limits. With 3 tiers of Artisan keycaps for marketing and low entry points.
- The grant covers all of the costs and Nouners mint for free. Profit from non-Noun holders goes to the project treasury until they can afford to buy a Noun and participate in governance.

### Intro
As one of the primary means of interacting with our online world, keyboards are more than just a tool – they've become a piece of personal expression. Let's design a keyboard a Nouns-themed Mechanical Keyboard (MK) that the community appreciates! NextMech and I are excited to bring this project to Nouns in collaboration with top-tier keyboard designers. With our internal MK knowledge and technical ability we plan to introduce the MK community to Nouns.

### Overview
Over the years, [an online subculture (reflected in partial MK ecosystem stats)](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/15W-Io9Y8zjAwppzKt9UkSLhiGImyQgc8J9M1UUUvh6o/edit?usp=sharing) has evolved, valuing custom keyboards as art pieces. This MK enthusiast community operates similarly to NFT communities. For instance, designers unveil their plans to collectors, who pre-order to finance manufacturing costs. The communities, decentralized across various platforms and websites, foster a rich dialogue between designers and fans. [They even organize global meetups](https://twitter.com/search?q=%22mechanical%20keyboard%20meet%22&src=typed_query). There's potential to gradually unify these communities to enhance the experiences.

![mk_reddit](https://github.com/profishional/nmk_files/blob/main/meetup.png?raw=true)

[SF meet March 5th, 2023 with photoshopped Nouns mk - [original photo](https://twitter.com/villi/status/1632132746029182977)]

The community activity and other meetups can be seen by searching for ["mechanical keyboard meet"](https://twitter.com/search?q=%22mechanical%20keyboard%20meet%22&src=typed_query) on Twitter/X or searching "[custom keyboard](https://www.instagram.com/explore/search/keyword/?q=custom%20keyboards)” on Instagram. This culture also extends into the gaming/work setups online. 

![instagram_mk.png](https://github.com/profishional/nmk_files/blob/main/instagram_mk.png?raw=true)

Also, looking at the r/MechanicalKeyboards subreddit we see the community is slowly growing over time: 
![meetup](https://github.com/profishional/nmk_files/blob/main/mk_reddit.png?raw=true)
[Here is a small data set that we have gathered on the ecosystem to provide more context.](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/15W-Io9Y8zjAwppzKt9UkSLhiGImyQgc8J9M1UUUvh6o/edit?usp=sharing)

### Us
NextMech and I (profish) began working on a project called Mechies last year which won a small prize in an Aussie hackathon. We thought about MK NFTs in different forms such as generative art with manufacturable traits, DAOs as Vendors for group buys, hardware-embedded signatures, etc., to help improve the ecosystem. But at the beginning of the year, we learned about Nouns and saw the potential for consumer-good NFTs. So we thought it would be interesting to run this experiment with the most vibrant NFT community.

We devised a proposal in April ([prop #266](https://nouns.wtf/vote/266)) with an ambitious plan. We listened to the feedback and created this revision. However, due to the uncertainty surrounding the fork, we delayed the initiative to observe the outcome and find a better time for our own schedules.

### Nouns x MKs
The proliferation can take immediate effect with current channels. For instance, the Nouns Esports team can incorporate keycaps into their gaming setup (without affecting functionality), showcasing to the gaming spectators. Nouns keycaps may serve as POAPs for crypto conference and hackathon participants, while the full Nouns keyboards are taken to global meetups. Furthermore, images of these keyboards and keycaps will appear on popular online forums and social media accounts of MK enthusiasts - the design is not going to be as blatant as the one you see, but rather more aesthetic and nuanced in appearance. Also, we plan to work with MK builders and reviewers who have hundreds of thousands, even millions of followers to showcase the MK and tell the Nouns DAO story.

### **Summary Plan**
Here is a simple cost breakdown. A more detailed breakdown is below:
* 75K to manufacture approximately 700 keycap sets, OR a maximum of 275 full keyboards OR some combination of the two depending on demand, while still meeting Minimum Order Quantity.
* 15K for assembling, packaging, storage, and decent-quality shipping.
* 29K for digital marketing and artisan keycap including low, medium, and high tiers.
* 35K for the team, MK designer, website, and fulfillment.

## **Total - 154K USD**

----

## FAQs
- **What will the design be?** NOT THE ONE YOU SEE. That is just to spark the imagination, the designer will come up with something much more aesthetic and subtle once we go through the brief.
- **Who is the designer?** They are one of the mentioned people below. Due to their high profile status in the MK community, they don't want to reveal their name until they see the support from Nouns and can begin working on it. I can assure you he is one of the best out there for this project.
- **Who is going to buy this?** Ideally NOT people in crypto. The point isn’t to sell it to Nouns holders, it's to distribute it to the MK community and proliferate the idea. That's also why we are working with a designer that the MK community respects.
- **How much are the NFTs?** Approximately $120-130 USD for the keycap set and $350-380 USD for the full keyboard option. Noun holders can purchase for free (within the budgeted units in the grant) while non-Noun holders will pay full price. We aim to distribute these on popular vendor platforms to maximize reach!
- **How does the redemption work?** Once you redeem, the NFT becomes non-transferable. Because sharing pictures of the keyboard is important and having an NFT is even better.
- **How are you going to sell to noncrypto people?** We aim to work with traditional distribution channels such as marketplaces and communities to reach the MK community. We are exploring solutions for wallet creation for the consumer at the purchase stage.
- **Why is it so expensive?** Custom mechanical keyboards by top-tier designers, with good quality switches, cases, and components can go around $500 USD. Given the interested designer and other components, this is a reasonable price.
- **How many units?** The free units for Noun holders would be Approximately 700 keycaps or 275 full keyboards or a combination that totals a maximum of 75k worth of manufacturing. We plan to sell more units for a profit to non-Nouns holders.
- **Will the keyboards be assembled?** We have an assembled and un-assembled option for the minters since for some collectors assembling is part of the custom MK experience.
- **How long does it take to deliver?** Design could be done quickly but we want to give the designer 4-6 weeks. Manufacturing takes about 6-7 months. Delivery should take 2-4 weeks. So about 8 months, but assuming unforeseen challenges we are accounting for 9-10 months from the time funds have been received.
- **What happens to the grant and mint profits?** The grant helps meet the Minimum Order Quantity for manufacturing which wouldn’t be possible otherwise. The profits from the non-Nouns holders go to the team which we expect to be less than 20K USD.
- **Will anything be returned to the Nouns DAO?** Because we are MK enthusiasts we simply want this to become a reality, so we have made the team portion of the grant very modest relative to the work it takes. But we are committed to using some of the profits to buy a Noun and participate in the community - this also incentivized Nouns to help the success of the project. We don’t think it’s Nounish to be underpaid, make direct payments to the DAO, and leave.
- **How big is the MK community?** The forums and discord servers of designers are similar to or, bigger in size and activity compared to crypto communities. It is pretty scattered online, but I have made a [spreadsheet here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/15W-Io9Y8zjAwppzKt9UkSLhiGImyQgc8J9M1UUUvh6o/edit?usp=sharing) to provide some context.
- **How will the project continue besides a one-off product?** We will plan an extension if this grant proves to be successful. It would involve creating a subDAO and experimenting with various products.

## Detailed Plan
Custom keyboard manufacturing involves two main components: the case and the keycap set. Switches and other components are also significant, but they are less customizable; therefore, we will simply use ones considered enthusiast grade. For a more detailed overview of mechanical keyboards, [check out this intro made by NextMech](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1gRH83pF1RBXW6Eve_OLC9Fb7hAlxQQEP/view?usp=sharing).

**Design -** To start, we will incorporate the Nouns brand into the keyboard canvas. We have talked to several designers who can create an aesthetic Noun-themed keyboard. These include [BIIP](https://instagram.com/biipmk), [NoPunIn10Did](https://nopunin10did.com/kat-napoleonic/), [sourmk](https://www.instagram.com/sourmk), pikku-allu, dededecline who would be able to capture the essence of the Nouns in a design. Also, a design by a top artist plays a major role in introducing Nouns to the MK community, ensuring a high-quality product that enthusiasts will enjoy. Here are some examples by the mentioned designers:

![biip_dots](https://github.com/profishional/nmk_files/blob/main/biip_dots.png?raw=true)
[BIIP Dots]

![Untitled](https://github.com/profishional/nmk_files/blob/main/mk_1.png?raw=true)
[Pikku Allu Symbiote]

![Untitled](https://github.com/profishional/nmk_files/blob/main/mk_2.png?raw=true)
[Sourmk Dandy]

**Manufacturing -** We will work with a manufacturer with double-shot ABS capability to be able to make high-quality keycaps. However, if the creative direction requires a custom font we may trade off double-shot quality for printing flexibility. As for the case, we will be using an available unit from existing manufacturer catalogs that matches the keycaps set. The remaining components will be wholesale units that are considered enthusiast-grade quality. 

**The NFT -** will include the custom design once the prototypes are finalized. Mint of keycaps will be priced at approximately $120-130 USD, while the full keyboard (including the keycaps) will be $350-380 USD. It will have boolean-based redemption on [nouns.mk](https://nouns.mk/) since we don't want to burn the NFT and instead share it online. We also aim to work with traditional distributors to be able to reach the MK community.

**Marketing -** Prior to, and during the minting of the Keyboard NFTs, we will launch digital and physical marketing efforts to increase the visibility of the project. The physical marketing is in the style of MK communities. We are considering 3 different types of artisan keycaps. The keycaps are, Resin filled 3D keycaps that could have Nouns characters or traits inside, high-quality metallic keycaps, and Plastic keycaps with Nouns related graphics that can be given away for free at crypto conferences and MK events, or for a low cost online.

Here are examples of existing Resin and metallic keycaps by artisans. They will be designed and produced in a Nouns related theme. These caps can be a great addition to the custom keyboard, or they allow MK enthusiasts to add it to their existing keyboards.

![resin_caps](https://github.com/profishional/nmk_files/blob/main/resin_cap.png?raw=true)
![metal_caps](https://github.com/profishional/nmk_files/blob/main/metal_cal.jpeg?raw=true)

**Delivery -** Once manufacturing, assembly, and quality tests are complete, the NFTs can be redeemed. They will be stored with a distributor or manufacturer and can be redeemed at any time. It is possible to sell the NFTs prior to redeeming them with a 5% royalty fee.

### **Current Progress**
We will keep up-to-date information and progress on our Notions page. Here are some highlights from the current progress:
- Determined feasible manufacturers for case and keycaps.
- Discussing terms with keycap set designer and singular keycap manufacturers.
- Registered [Nouns.mk](http://nouns.mk/) domain, Twitter/X [@nounsmk](https://twitter.com/nounsmk), ENS [nounsmk.eth](https://app.safe.global/home?safe=eth%3A0x144975eEc9674fd0Af3d6F3FBa8D660879cE3881), and nounsmkdao.eth for marketing.
- Updated budget and design constraints from previous proposal attempts.

## **Team**
**[Profish](https://twitter.com/profishcrypto)**: My past experience is creating wallets and automation a crypto trading companies and cadCAD tokenomics. Also, as part of the DAO Under community, I've project managed and launched [bookclub.wtf](http://bookclub.wtf)[.](http://Bookclub.wtf)

**[NextMech](https://instagram.com/next.mech)**: Michael runs a boutique custom MK business and has a deep understanding of the industry. Additionally, as a full-stack developer, which helps him plan NFT products effectively!

- Work with a designer to come up with the final design + begin talking to the manufacturer

# NounsWatch: Iconic Nouns Timepieces

![](https://i.imgur.com/qj6bN2J.png)

# The Noggles meant to be worn all day and night
NounsWatch is a tangible representation of what the Nouns community is capable of, and adds to the other successfully funded initiatives extending the brand to a whole new universe of Fashion AND Watch enthusiasts. It seamlessly combines nounishness and horology, **on the verge of becoming the most personal product Nouns has ever created**.

`⌐◨-◨ for the wrists`

---

## Positioning
The watch industry is a lucrative market, with the segment accounting for over US$70 billion in revenue in 2022. We aim to position NounsWatch within the most attractive range of world-class watch brands: the affordable design (<200 USD).

![](https://i.imgur.com/DprKVhF.png)


---
## The NounsWatch design
Designed by renowned watch designer Rafael Miranda, the bold Noggle-inspired design features a superb polycarbonate case, a Japanese movement, and a exquisite half display with a glass mirror and a black dial.
![](https://i.imgur.com/PleFEx9.png)
The strap is made of easy interchangeable silicone rubber in either one color or the available Nouns Accessory themes (TBD).

![](https://i.imgur.com/9ptDzga.png)
The hour and minute handles features individual pieces that combines every hour to form the Noggles symbol.

![](https://i.imgur.com/mEBtHNJ.gif)

Not only have we considered its aesthetic appeal, focusing on style and taste, but we've also paid meticulous attention to its function. It's as much about refinement as it is about precision.

---
## Specs

**Case:** Polycarbonate, 42 mm x 42 mm x 6 mm. Fits from wrists of 15cm and up
**Movement:** Japanese
**Dial**: Exquisite half display reading system, black dial with contrasting numbers
**Glass:** Mineral glass with anti-reflective coating 
**Strap:** Easy interchangeable silicone rubber in various colors and patterns

---
## First Prototypes
In order to show our commitment to the project, we have developed two 3d printed prototypes as you can see below. Imagine how amazing they will look with the final production finish and the colored straps!

![](https://i.imgur.com/Fm1vcc4.png)

---

## Timeline
![](https://i.imgur.com/ugqJkvg.png)


**Phase 1: Prototype (done √)**

**Phase 2 (option1): NFT Airdrop (~2 weeks)**
As soon as the prop get funded, we are going to take a snapshot and airdrop 888 Nounswatch NFTs to Nouns holders (incl. Treasury Nouns). Each Nounswatch NFT is eligible to redeem 1 (one) physical Nounswatch on [https://nounswatch.com](https://nounswatch.com/) (beta), thus no need to connect and verify Nouns tokens.

**Phase 2: Color and straps variants definition (~2 weeks)**
- watch crown side
- 8 solid color variants (body + strap)
- 8 strap patterns that will be produced.

**Phase 3: Claim window (~4 weeks)**
Our Shopify storefront is gonna showcase the product, including all watch colors and strap variants available and handle the redeem information. By connecting wallet with web3 connect, token holders are eligible a FREE watch + two straps of choice + shipping. The claiming window is needed to guarantee quantities for each body/strap colors. After the window, we no longer guarantee the colors, and the redemption will be first come first serve.

**Phase 4: Production (~8 weeks)**
We are going to share images and content of the entire production process (moulding, injection, painting etc).

**Phase 5: Assembling, Packaging & Shipping  (~2 weeks)**
After receiving the final product from the factory we initiate the assembling, packaging, handling and shipping of Nounswatch to users.

**Phase 6: warranty and after sales service for 2 years**
