# 

![Header](https://i.imgur.com/YBiw7Zu.gif)
**Play as One Noun, Every Day, Forever, in an action rogue-lite game developed in collaboration with Nouns and Forgotten Runes Wizard’s Cult to be released on Steam/PC!**

### **TL;DR**
We are asking for $75,000 to deliver a polished and playable vertical slice for our indie Nouns game developed in Godot 4.  We will also explore the game mechanics and creative direction with the Nouns community to discover product-market fit.

Changes from [Prop 414 (Version 1)](https://nouns.wtf/vote/414):
- Focused attention on our One Noun, Every Day core mechanic and game play 
- Expanded on creative direction and process to capture the Nounish personality
- Provided a detailed scope for the vertical slice deliverables
- Added long term vision for collaboration with the Nouns community, and strategy partnerships with Nouns Esports and Forgotten Runes Wizard's Cult

**Play our pre-production Demo [HERE](https://thepixelshop.itch.io/nounstown-demo)!**

# A Vertical Slice of One Noun, Every Day

![stage_nouns_v_souls.png](https://i.imgur.com/pBTUbZl.png)

**The One Noun, Every Day game mode will be the hook and anchor behind this game.  We want to re-imagine the continuity and diversity of Nouns through the lens of a dynamic and captivating game for the masses**.  

Just as each blockchain hash determines the traits for each noun, every day, we will use a game seed to generate new elements for a each game, every day.  These changing elements include Nouns equipped with fun and diverse items, a generative world map populated with vibrant environments, random upgrades available to select from, and enemy minions and bosses you must battle to win.  Every player will have a 24 hour rolling period to defeat each version of the game.  This innovative mechanic has the potential to fuel a social and competitive gaming culture due to the following reasons:

- Replayability - Optimize gameplay strategies through trial and error as you explore new characters and maps
- Progression - Unlock new content and playable characters to use in the “Classic Mode” by defeating the game and a robust achievement system
- Competition - Compete against all other players for the fastest clear time, and more importantly, bragging rights!
- Game Metas - Discover unpredictable metas in a dynamic Nounish world

## **Funding Details and Deliverables**

**We are asking for $75,000 to develop a polished and playable vertical slice of the One Noun, Every Day game loop to demonstrate our intended player experience.** 

This funding request provides for a $65,000 production budget (approximately 1,500 hours) and a $10,000 marketing budget, over an approximately 3-month period.  Key features required to produce this vertical slice include player character design, items and upgrades, environment design, sound design, UI/UX, and a single boss encounter.  Each feature will go through design and documentation, art and animation, programming and development, sound design, and testing and quality assurance, as applicable.  The deliverables and estimated allocation are as follows:

- 1 Boss Encounter - 20 percent or 300 hours
- Generative Map and Environment Assets - 20 percent or 300 hours
- 7 Items and 7 Upgrades - 15 percent or 225 hours
- 7 Rotating Nouns Characters - 15 percent or 225 hours
- Sound design for completed features - 10 percent or 150 hours
- Functional UI/UX for Menus and Gameplay - 10 percent or 150 hours
- Comprehensive Game Design Document - 10 percent or 150 hours

We have allocated a marketing budget of $10,000 to produce the following deliverables:

- Branding and Marketing Assets
- Establish Social Media presence and Steam Page
- Professional Teaser Trailer

# Creative Direction
![Comic Strip](https://i.imgur.com/Aw5LE39.png)
## Nouns

Our game embraces a clash of two starkly contrasting worlds. On one side, the Nounish personality will be at the core of the player character, the items and upgrades you acquire during each run, and NPCs you discover over time.  These elements will be designed to permeate Nounish personality through vibrant colors, joyful energy, and whimsical ideas. 

### Items

We are exploring ideas that are “outside of the box” and consistent with the outlandish and diversely strange Nouns world.  These items will be packed with personality but also provide distinct play styles.  Early concepts we have explored include the Gnome Chuckaz, Sliced Bread Shurikens, and Pinata Blitzers:
![item concepts](https://i.imgur.com/i2ciy7e.png)
*Concept design for potential items*
### Upgrades

As the player clears each room,  they are rewarded a pair of Noggles that unlocks a powerful new upgrade to use during the run.  Players will experiment with different combinations of upgrades to create fun synergies and provide a unique gameplay experience each run.  Each upgrade is inspired by various characters from the Nouns collection. 
![upgrade concepts](https://i.imgur.com/rUVjlxX.png) 


## Forgotten Souls

And on the other side, you'll uncover the corrupt Forgotten Souls that have crossed into the Nouniverse upon discovering the power of Noggles.  The Souls are holding Nouns captive in their inanimate forms and using the power from the stolen Noggles to convert the Nouniverse into their own shadowy realm.  The Souls will serve as the enemy minions, bosses, and antagonist of our game, designed with contrasting dark personalities and colors.  

### Minions

All minions will be designed to showcase their haunting personalities through fantastical and diverse character design, animations, and attack styles.  The contrasting nature of the minions will provide for an aesthetic design that emphasizes readability and a visual feeling of cleansing the corruption from Nouns Town as the player progresses.  
![Minions](https://i.imgur.com/aZx9FC4.png)


### Bosses

Our boss encounters thrive to be one of the more memorable experiences that you will encounter in our game.  Our bosses will be inspired by rare Forgotten Souls characters but have our own stylistic flare.  These boss encounters will be visually stunning and paired with cohesive game play mechanics that immerse and challenge the player.  

## Environment

The collision of these two distinct moods creates a captivating experience.  Each run will begin as a corrupt Nouniverse that has taken over by the Souls.  As the player progresses through the map, the corruption is pushed back and the vibrant Nounish world is slowly restored!  

![World Concept](https://i.imgur.com/qC0bTvv.png)
*Concept design for an environment that we will design a tile set for*

We’ll design Nounish locations with their own distinct and colorful themes, from quaint towns and snowy wonderlands, to barren deserts and tropical beaches.  Each playable location will go through a similar design process and produce the following deliverables:

- Concept Design - Establish the location’s identity with clearly defined characteristics
- Map Assets - Represent each location by a low resolution design in the Overworld Map
- Tile Sets -  Outfit the walls, floors, and objects within the rooms of each location.  
- Decorations and Objects - Fill each room with decorations for personality and destructible objects for an interactive setting
    ![Demo Tileset](https://i.imgur.com/Bc2Ms0C.png)
*Concept tile set used in demo that will receive a Nounish update*
## Creative Commons

All of the art and animations that we produce will be open-source and available for anyone to use!

# Future Vision

**The goal of this proposal is to “follow the fun” through addicting game play and Nounish creative expressions.  However, we have a long term vision to produce and distribute a fully fleshed out Nouns indie game.**

### Additional Classic Mode

Our core game loop will be the One Noun, Every Day game mode.  However, as the player character and map remain constant in this game mode, we also plan to release a Classic Mode to serve as a more traditional rogue-lite focused on randomness and meta progression, or progression that exists outside of regular gameplay.  In this mode, no two runs will be the same as a fresh new map is generated with each play through.  

But there’s also significant depth beyond the randomness.  This mode will be accompanied with a robust achievement system that challenges the player to unlock exciting new items, upgrades, and cosmetics.  

### Organic Growth

During development, we’ll maintain a steady pipeline of project updates, promotional content, and social engagement to generate organic growth.  Additionally, we plan to attend major game development conventions such as GDC, PAX, and Gamescon to engage with our community in person.  

### Game Distribution

We will use Steam as our primary distribution platform to release the game.  Steam provides access to the largest PC gaming community, as well as extensive marketing and analytics features.  We will explore porting the game to Nintendo Switch post-release to reach a wider audience.

## Collaboration

### Nouns Community

We are committed to an open and inclusive collaboration process throughout production.  We will regularly engage with select community members to explore creative discussions, validate game design concepts, and explore marketing opportunities.  Our goal is to create an immersive game that represents the Nounish identity and resonates with both the community and the player.  

### Forgotten Runes Wizard’s Cult

The game will be in collaboration with our friends from the Forgotten Runes Wizard’s Cult.  Their team is well-respected and produce engaging and high-quality products and experiences.  This collaboration brings promotional support from both their community and team’s established network within the gaming, content creation, and entertainment industries.  This partnership presents an opportunity to elevate our game, expand its reach, and enhance the prospect for breakout success.

### Nouns Esports

We will collaborate with Nouns Esports to generate excitement and promotional content with the game launch.  This partnership will explore ideas to engage the Nouns gaming community primarily through streaming, competitions, and giveaways.  

# Why a Nounish indie game?

A rogue-lite indie game provides a compelling opportunity for Nouns to enter the gaming sector:

### Creative Expression

Indie games provide for a perfect landscape to build a Nounish world complete with innovative game mechanics that are complimented with vibrant aesthetics and visual representation.  We aim to populate our world with original Nouns characters, an outlandish environment, and charming storytelling to engage players and cultivate a connection to Nouns culture.    

### Strategic Advantages

Our small indie team provides several advantages including streamlined communication, transparency, adaptability, and a strong team synergy.  Yet, while being a small team, we have access to powerful platforms such as Godot for development, Steam for distribution, and social media and Discord for our community.  Our game is thoughtfully designed to pack a punch with addictive gameplay mechanics, engaging progression and replayability, and long-term scalability and new content.  We’re able to accomplish all of this within a reasonable scope and production budget, and without sacrificing on the game’s entertainment or aesthetics.

## Genre

Our genre of choice may be a mouthful (Non Linear Action Rogue-Lite Bullet Hell…) but it’s a great platform for a Nouns game.  The generative rogue features share a strong parallel with the Nounish identity; bullet hells offer replayability.  We have described the key features of each sub-genres and the games that inspire us below:

### Rogue-Lite

The key feature of a Rogue-Lite genre is a game loop that results in permadeath.  Each time a player begins their attempt or run, they will either defeat the final boss or die trying.  A Rogue-Lite game generally involves some meta progression that takes place outside of the run; usually in the form of upgraded items, statistics, abilities, or skill trees.

### Bullet Hell

Bullet Hell combat mechanics emphasize complex bullet patterns for the player to navigate and dodge.  Our bullet hell game will be designed as a twin stick shooter where the player is on a flat plane with a top-down perspective.  

### Non-Linear Progression

One of the unique selling points of our Rogue-Lite game is that it will have Non-Linear progression.  The two main features to highlight in this design include a unique map that is generated each run and the freedom for the player to decide their order of progression.   

### Inspiration
[Enter the Gungeon](https://store.steampowered.com/app/311690/Enter_the_Gungeon/), [Hades](https://store.steampowered.com/app/1145360/Hades/), [Risk of Rain 2](https://store.steampowered.com/app/632360/Risk_of_Rain_2/), [Nuclear Throne](https://store.steampowered.com/app/242680/Nuclear_Throne/), [Vampire Survivors](https://store.steampowered.com/app/1794680/Vampire_Survivors/)

# Why The Pixel Shop?

![The Pixel Shop](https://i.imgur.com/57yu7tx.png)

[The Pixel Shop](https://thepixelshop.app) is an independent Art and Game Development studio founded in March 2022. We are a team of four talented artists and developers with over 30 years of art and game development experience, collectively.  Our team has experience producing artwork with major indie game studios; developing game engines, commercial software, and game mods; and managing large scope projects through completion. 

As a team, we recently led the creative and art direction for Battle for Goblin Town, an upcoming on-chain “Settlers of Catan” style game developed by [Forgotten Runes Wizard’s Cult](https://www.forgottenrunes.com/).  During this project, we designed and produced all of the art assets, UI/UX, [gameplay trailer](https://x.com/GoblinTown_Game/status/1708859222623232363?s=20).

For this project, we animated all 10,000 Moonbirds as pixel sprites and introduced a mini-game as a proof-of-work to showcase how these sprites can be used in indie-game development.  All of the artwork produced for this project is cc0 for others to enjoy and build on.  Check out our [Mini-Game](https://thepixelshop.itch.io/moonbirds) and [GitHub repository](https://github.com/the-pixelshop/moonbirds).

# NOUNS AFRICA - FESTIVAL MARKETING & NOUNS COFFEE

![COFFEE MACHINE AD](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/H1BHya4Ea.jpg)[Watch The Ad](https://youtu.be/BldlJ7ETh_s)

Hi All, Pierre here from Nouns Whisky in South Africa. 
 
As mentioned in my Whisky Prop 208: I would research various consumables that we’ll tie into the ecosystem that we are currently building in South Africa while the whisky ages. We’ve currently sold 10 barrels: 3 to Noun12, 1 to 0xDigitalOil, 3 to a collector in the Netherlands, and 3 via the Distillery. As we launched on September 7th, this is a great start, as the sales amount to 400 bottles of Nouns Whisky that are now owned and will be brought into the world. We will continue to sell barrels / bottles, but keep in mind that this will be done slowly and surely. Doing it the right way is important. The Dao owns 100 barrels (4000 bottles), and our primary responsibility is to deliver that in 2027. If the Dao chooses to sell all 4000 bottles in South Africa, we can do that easily via the Distillery, stores, and events. The DAO can then choose to have that income returned to the treasury or reinvest it to further build Nouns Africa.

With that being said, I decided to focus on Nouns Coffee in South Africa, as the IP has already been designed and paid for, and the product launched in the USA with a successful proof of concept. If this prop is sponsored and passes, this will be a second case study in my opinion, a ‘how to guide’ by using existing Nouns consumable IP and how to implement and introduce it to the public in another country.

There is a festival called Cotton Fest that is being held in Johannesburg on the 24th of February 2024 with an attendance of 7000 to 10000 people. This will be the perfect opportunity to hand out 1000 free paper Noggles that we received from Klim and launch [http://www.nouns.africa](http://www.nouns.africa) and Nouns Coffee.

The goal here is to build a long-term relationship with Cotton Fest over the next 3 years so that we can stock Nouns Whisky as well at the festival when it matures (Nouns Whisky owned by the Dao or the Distillery). Secondly, to put Nouns in the hands of general festival goers, trendsetters, and musicians and get them to engage with the Nouns Africa website and use their free vouchers to place a coffee bag order after the event. With a large number of people at the festival, I’m confident that trendsetters will be taking photos with Noggles and posting them on Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook which is always a win-win scenario. Cotton Fest is one of the biggest events in Cape Town, Durban, and Johannesburg during the summer. The Nouns Africa website will be used primarily to showcase Nouns Coffee, Nouns Whisky, and all things Nouns from around the world. This will be the first Nouns activation of its type in Africa.

**BUDGET: 10 ETH ($20 000)**

**FIRST PHASE - Cotton Fest Marketing / Nouns Africa Launch**

- Buy sponsorship rights to Cotton Fest to promote Nouns Coffee / Nouns DAO
- Hand out Free Nouns Paper Noggles - 1000 units
- Free Nouns Tote Bags with various branded items - 500 units
- R100 Nouns Africa Shopify Gift Voucher - 300 units
- Free Nouns Coffee taster sachets - 3000 units to take home.
- Free Nouns Caps & T-Shirts - 200 units

**SECOND PHASE - Coffee Bag Production**

- 3 x Nouns Coffee plastic bag designs with zip seal - 1500 units (250g, 500g, 1kg)
- The MOQ is 500 per design/size (2/3 months printing from China)
- Paid Ads to drive website views via Instagram / Facebook / Twitter

**THIRD PHASE - Legal & Finance**

- Register Nouns Coffee (Pty) Ltd.
- Register for VAT & SARS details.
- Open a business bank account + Visa Card for payments.
- Monthly accounting & compliance fees.

There will be additional phases to bring Nouns Coffee / Nouns Africa to market and separate props will be put forward to fund these opportunities:

- Listing and stocking [http://www.takealot.com](http://www.takealot.com) & [http://www.onedayonly.com](http://www.onedayonly.co.za) with a small batch of products.
- Listing and stocking in [http://www.pnp.co.za](http://www.pnp.co.za) with 2 x pallets of product to be distributed into chain stores nationwide. Our coffee supplier will help us here.
- Build a Nouns Coffee activation stand at Cotton Fest in 2024 and sponsor the festival skate park with some free Nouns skateboard decks.
- Take Nouns Africa to [http://www.safashionweek.co.za](http://www.safashionweek.co.za) and showcase the fashion side of the brand + whisky & coffee.

I have built the Nouns Africa Website [http://www.nouns.africa](http://www.nouns.africa) so that voters can see how this prop will look from a buyer's perspective. The website is a work in progress and will be ready to launch on the 24th of February if this prop passes and we’re able to introduce Nouns DAO to the trendsetters in Johannesburg at: [http://www.cottonfest.co.za](http://www.cottonfest.co.za)

Thanks for taking the time to read this prop.

# # "Book of Nouns" - 名詞の本 - An Internet-first Anime Story  !

# "Book of Nouns" - 名詞の本 - An Internet-first Anime Story

![](https://i.postimg.cc/W4J3M71X/final-keyvisual-nouns-1-1-1.png)

### TL,DR
This proposal is seeking 96,000 USDC to conceptualise an original anime universe based on ⌐◨-◨. Within scope of this proposal, we will develop original anime / video stories (60-65 / 10-15 seconds runtime each) fit for short format distribution over social media on the course of five months totalling a run-time of 12-14 mins.  

### Inspiration
Nouns have explored different art directions over time that gravitated towards a more westernised aesthetic and kids/family genre + focused on more wholesome vibes. Nouns Movie, Wizard Hat Short film, Nouns Short Film festival are good examples of that. We wanted to propose a radically different art direction which focuses more on ["Seinen" than "Shonen".](https://www.cbr.com/reasons-love-shonen-anime-why-love-seinen-anime/)

![](https://i.postimg.cc/5tZPbVxk/Screen-Shot-2023-11-12-at-8-27-29-AM.png)

With Book of Nouns, we want to create a world which is more adult themed, more brain food & thought provoking, and has a diehard community of fans who love it.

---
### The World (世界) defined
![](https://i.postimg.cc/s21kYNp9/12.png)

![](https://i.postimg.cc/J7j95JBg/22.png)

![](https://i.postimg.cc/MKJb13kk/23-1.png)

![](https://i.postimg.cc/X7Kh5yz8/24.png)

![](https://i.postimg.cc/j5Z2C5rd/25.png)

![](https://i.postimg.cc/KY43LBJ3/26.png)

![](https://i.postimg.cc/7YwSQCKb/27.png)

You can also access this preliminary world bible [here](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1biGXr_Ogmkorw0SzjqAAeOfAofwWebHK/view) in pdf format.

---

![](https://i.postimg.cc/YCT2qmzg/Character-sheet-greyscale.png)

---


### Who is making this happen?
![](https://i.postimg.cc/wBTbkJgX/Screen-Shot-2023-11-11-at-9-01-06-PM.png)

**Creative Director**
My name is [Erene](https://twitter.com/EreneAnimation). I have worked as a Lead Artist and creative director in the anime industry for over 10 years now. I had the opportunity to contribute in Attack on Titan S1, Vinland Saga, Demon Slayer, Star Wars Visions etc to name a few. I've since found my passion in independent work and when i heard about Nouns, I fell in love with the idea and the goals! 


**Animation Director**
Meet my co-director [Ivan Mina](https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/encyclopedia/people.php?id=95895). Ivan has been a veteran in the Animation Industry being Key Animators in the OG One Piece Series, Digimon etc. Ivan is a long-time Toei Animation Alumnus and currently mentors and freelances all over the world on incredible Anime titles.

Here is the full list of team of people involved on "Book of Nouns". We're based out of Korea, Philippines and Vietnam.
![](https://i.postimg.cc/0QjxqV3W/Screen-Shot-2023-11-12-at-6-52-59-AM.png)
![](https://i.postimg.cc/qvrNddG1/Screen-Shot-2023-11-12-at-6-53-13-AM.png)

Together we are known as Otsu Labs. We've worked with MAPPA, Toei Animation, WIT Studios and MadHouse and now want to create an original anime universe built atop of cc0 art and ethos.

Check out our Showreel
[![](https://i.postimg.cc/qMnjZPZT/Group-228-1.png)](https://streamable.com/3fnai7)



### Why this specific format?

In adult anime genre, World building needs to be deliberate and today's internet is the new testbed of rapid iteration. In the traditional ways, you have seen authors build following on a franchise through Manga / Comics (e.g. Jujitsu Kaisen)Webtoons or Manhwa (e.g. Solo Levelling) before they graduated into a full anime adaption.

***We have done this before.***

[![](https://i.postimg.cc/TPyyt6Cj/19.png)](https://www.instagram.com/ereneanimation/)

Another example is [Luna Gardner](https://www.tiktok.com/@crc_luna?lang=en) who does chain based interactive story where fans co-investigate with her to solve a mystery.

**In Summary...**
We want to experiment with short video format to weave a story with dozens of pieces which we can iterate and can compete in shrinking attention environment. It becomes an alternative to developing the lore via traditional mediums like manga where distribution continues to be a chokepoint for many.

Once a core fanbase is established, you can proceed with more confidence to tackle time consuming formats like full-anime series which is resource intensive. (Attack of Titan S1 took 2+ years to make!)


---

### Funding and Milestones
We're requesting 96,000 USDC to help us jumpstart this world. 100% of the funding goes into early conceptualisation, spinning up the social properties, and production. 

We will be building out dedicated "Book-of-Nouns" social presence alongside a web property to house this growing world view as more is revealed to the fans. 

#### Funding
The funding is requested in 2 parts: 

- 96,000 USDC via a stream for a period of 5 months from Dec 15, 2024 till May 15, 2024. 

#### Milestones 

- Hit 100k+ audience built up across all "bookofnouns" channels. 30mil+ in impressions.
- Explore with multiple media formats (high velocity short videos, illustrations, 4コマ漫画 / 4 Koma Manga) etc.
- Deliver 60-65 pieces of visual micro-stories amounting totol 12-14 mins of animated runtime that tell a story, establish the core MCs (main characters) and the world they live in.
- Build a website where bookofnouns world bible resides, alongside all of the visuals integrated.
- Proposal updates sent onchain along the way with published growth signals.

#### What is Atrium's role in this project?
Atrium introduced us to nouns through the nouns movie project. We will rely on their guidance to plan and appropriately reflect the core nouns ethos in the world we build.


After spending more than a decade co-creating the best anime you've watched and love, We want to make something for Nouns and ourselves.

---
### What comes after?
If we are successful in establishing the core true fan group via this project, we will have the groundwork ready for a lasting anime brand people love and follow passionately.

Opportunities are endless

- Manga adaptations 
- Short films 
- Anime episodic content

...While retaining ownership because of the said fan group.


***All roads lead back to nouns.***

# Nouns DAO V3.1 Minor Fix

## TLDR

- We deployed V3 with the same Vote with Refund bug [we fixed in V2.1](https://www.nouns.camp/proposals/169).
- This proposal upgrades the DAO with a minor fix.
- This version is not audited; we’re confident enough with the internal review we conducted.

## Fix summary

Change the refund destination such that multisig voters that pay for gas get refunded, rather than sending the refund to the multisig contract. Technically, this change involves refunding tx.origin instead of msg.sender.

Exact changes can be seen in [this pull request](https://github.com/nounsDAO/nouns-monorepo/pull/813).

Because this change is very minor, we're not going through an official audit process. This change has been reviewed by solimander.

## Why this happened

We started work on V3 before the V2.1 fix, and V3 is in different files so syncing the master branch into the V3 branch did not apply the fix to V3 code.

Here’s a short sequence of events:

1. September 22, 2022 [v3 branch]: the branch that later becomes DAO V3 is created with initial code experiments.
2. October 25, 2022 [dao 2.1 branch]: refund bug fixed.
3. November 2, 2022 [v3 branch]: we sync from master and create a new DAO V3 file.
4. November 9, 2022 [master] refund fix merged into master, to be deployed.
5. January 4, 2023 [v3 branch] we sync from master, the refund fix is updated in the DAO V2 file, but we are focused on V3 and do not examine the merge carefully and miss the opportunity to copy the fix into V3.
6. January 11, 2023 [v3 branch] we split DAO V3 into library files to overcome the contract size limit; this change makes the bug harder to discover, as we lose the ability to directly compare V3 to V2 line for line, as we still could have done between V2 and V1.

Another problem was that we did not copy or change all V1/V2 tests to test V3; most of the tests were copied to run on V3 as well, but we dropped the ball on the gas refund test.

## How we’re preventing it from happening again

1. Make sure tests are always running against the latest version.
2. When merging a fix to master, make sure to correctly merge it into any open branch.

Running all tests on the latest version is the most important takeaway. As part of working on this fix we made sure all DAO tests are now running on the latest version, and removed old duplicate tests that were testing older versions. We believe we’ve reduced the chances of this happening again significantly.

The second point is helpful as an extra layer of safety, mostly helpful if we don’t have sufficient tests or failed to run all tests against the latest version we’re working on. We will certainly be more mindful in future merges.

## Transaction

The transaction sets the DAO proxy implementation to be the fixed version deployed at [0xe3caa436461DBa00CFBE1749148C9fa7FA1F5344](https://etherscan.io/address/0xe3caa436461dba00cfbe1749148c9fa7fa1f5344).

Thanks,

the verbs ⌐◨-◨

# Let's take Prop House IRL 💡

![](https://i.imgur.com/WGADi5G.gif)

[Prop House](https://prop.house) is an excellent entry point for builders in the Nouns ecosystem. The Nouns in Rio team is requesting **10 ETH + 10,500 USDC** to create an immersive 2-day event and take Prop House IRL.

We received so much support from the community [last time](https://nounsagora.com/proposals/360) that we're putting this up again. But unlike our last proposal, which focused on sponsoring a conference and setting up a booth, we're now aiming to host **our very own event.**

![](https://i.imgur.com/i4GzPZG.png)

This proposal is set to trigger a waterfall effect within Prop House, starting by **bringing in five new communities.** Each community will open gates for thousands of builders, expanding the platform's reach and impact. Keep reading to find out how we'll do it 👇

![](https://i.imgur.com/4tpMuq7.png)

Prop House is a platform where communities can fund their builders, so we'll make this event community-focused. We'll allocate **2 ETH to each of 5 communities**, with one essential rule: they must use it to establish their houses and conduct their own rounds on Prop House.

![](https://i.imgur.com/3AUURR4.png)

People will register for the event and indicate which community they belong to. We'll have a preset list of web3 communities in Rio, but participants will also have the option to add their own. We're expecting around 100 attendees.
‎ 
## How 👀

![](https://i.imgur.com/41AKVPW.png)

To tell the story of Prop House, we need to go back and explain Nouns first. So, the first talk will be about Nouns and how it's growing in Brazil. Then, we'll have a talk about Prop House and how it works. After a break, we’ll host a workshop on writing great proposals and share examples of successful ones.

Participants will then have free time to write and submit their proposals, detailing the rounds they plan to set up in their new house on Prop House, utilizing the 2 ETH prize as a reward. After that, we'll kick off an afterparty, offering a perfect opportunity for communities to interact and engage with each other.

![](https://i.imgur.com/0i64qr7.png)

The second day will start with a talk about the CC0 culture hosted by [Public Good Beer](https://twitter.com/publicgoodbeer). After that, we'll offer a workshop on how to set up a Prop House house and plan rounds.

Last but not least, the voting begins! We'll use a [representative system](https://imgur.com/m5eKE99) for fairness. After voting, we'll announce the winners and outline the next steps. The event will conclude with an amazing Brazilian barbecue, featuring live music and a **Public Good Beer** activation for all to enjoy.

Winning communities will join the Nouns in Rio Discord server. Our team will guide them in setting up their houses, managing rounds, and distributing prizes. If a community doesn't execute its plan within 3 months, **the ETH returns to the DAO.**
‎ 
## Mentors 🫡

3 mentors will lead the workshop on how to write a good proposal and will be available to assist the teams during the Prop Session. [JP](https://twitter.com/eusou_jp) has submitted dozens of proposals on Prop House, many of which have been approved. [TheBower](https://twitter.com/thebower_) is a Nouner and a Gardener, having voted in many rounds. [Guiriba](https://twitter.com/guiribabrb) is a researcher and has a lot to teach about governance.

![](https://i.imgur.com/UQw87AM.png)
‎ 
## Communities 🤝

Two weeks before the event, we'll start communicating it on our channels, inviting people to apply and explaining how the experience will work. This ensures attendees are well-prepared and ready to actively contribute.

Members of the [Ponziverse](https://twitter.com/JoeyPonzi) and from the [Casta Crypto](https://twitter.com/castacrypto) community have already signaled interest in being part of the experience, and of course, [NounsBR](https://twitter.com/nounsbr), [Gnars](https://twitter.com/gnars_dao), and [Nouns Graffiti](https://twitter.com/Nounsgraffiti) are all in.

We'll also be committed to bringing education-focused communities to the event, such as [Educarmais](https://twitter.com/educarmaisrj) and [Futuroon DAO](https://twitter.com/futuroon). Students from UFF, PUC, and UFRJ - three of the biggest universities in Rio - will join us as well. 
‎ 
## Public Good Beer 🍻

Drinks on them! They'll host a talk about the CC0 culture and how the beer was funded by Nouns. Attendees will also receive free beer and collect [gotas.social](gotas.social) NFTs!

![](https://i.imgur.com/gZz0uTI.png)
‎ 
## Why 🤔

We want communities to see Prop House as a place to fund their builders and individuals to see it as a way to bring their ideas to life. By showcasing the diverse groups already benefiting from the platform, we hope to inspire them to **engage their own communities** in similar ways.

Check out all the amazing things that have come from Prop House. **Nouns has funded one of the best web3 platforms, and it's high time we spread the word about it.**

![](https://i.imgur.com/XnCp7Tz.png)
‎ 
## Where 📍

Our Prop House IRL Experience will be hosted at [casaJOMO.art](https://www.instagram.com/casajomo.art), a super cozy villa located in Santa Teresa, built in the 1930s by two Spanish families. Learn more [here.](https://casajomo.art/about)

![](https://i.imgur.com/El7FbKV.png)
‎ 
## Budget 💰

With **10 ETH**, we aim to support 5 communities, thus benefiting numerous builders and a wide range of projects with significant ETH value. The total event cost, including team compensation, amounts to **10,500 USDC.**

![](https://i.imgur.com/vXhoJ0z.png)
‎ 
## Team 🤝

This proposal is a collaborative effort between [Nouns in Rio](https://twitter.com/NounsInRio) and [Rio Crypto Hub](https://twitter.com/RioCryptoHub), two teams dedicated to promoting web3 in the wonderful city of Rio de Janeiro.

# Evaluation of the Private Voting Research Sprint solutions (and advising on next steps for Nouns!)

# TL;DR

This is a proposal to fund Nethermind Research to evaluate each of the 3 solutions provided to Nouns DAO in response to its [Private Voting Research Sprint](https://prop.house/nouns/private-voting-research-sprint). In this work, Nethermind Research will produce a report to help Nouns DAO and its contributors understand the upsides and tradeoffs of each solution, along with suggestions for the DAO’s next steps. 

The proposal has been prepared in consultation with the Verbs team, who have expressed interest in the execution of this work.

# Background

In February 2023, Nouns DAO issued a call for proposals, inviting cryptography experts to research solutions to private voting for Nouns DAO. This initiative was accompanied by a specification of requirements, some of which were mandatory (e.g., votes’ privacy is preserved forever, support for delegation, no centralized dependencies), while others were deemed “nice to have” (e.g., support some voters choosing public voting, not relying on a dispute period). The full list of requirements can be found [here](https://hackmd.io/SVyDLBq7QSWNl0LaYIuqHA?view).

In response, 20 proposals were issued, of which the top 3 most supported ones were awarded a grant by Nouns DAO to carry out the research and scoping of their proposed solution. The winning teams (in order of votes) were

- [Poseidon](https://hackmd.io/6ZFxxxnKT0iH-GJHUxKekw#TLDR)
- [Aragon/Aztec](https://research.aragon.org/nouns.html)
- [Vortex](https://mizu-dao.github.io/vortex/)

(The list above links the results of each team’s finished work)

This initiative attracted proposals with a high level of technical and cryptographic finesse. As such, for adequate assessment of the deliverables and advising on the next steps, it is in the best interest of Nouns DAO and its contributors to receive guidance from a neutral party with deep cryptographic expertise. The above has been echoed by the Verbs team as well, who expressed their interest in an independent assessment of the three solutions.

In light of the above, our team of blockchain and cryptography experts at Nethermind Research kindly offers its services to Nouns DAO.

# About Nethermind Research

Nethermind is a team of world-class builders and researchers with expertise across several domains: Ethereum Protocol Engineering, Cryptography Research, Layer-2s, Decentralized Finance, Smart Contract Development, Security Auditing, and Formal Verification, among others.

Our Research team comprises mathematicians and engineers who work on analyzing, breaking, and designing blockchain and cryptographic schemes. Our expertise and interests span the fields of zero-knowledge proofs, [distributed key generation](https://medium.com/nethermind-eth/a-tour-of-verifiable-secret-sharing-schemes-and-distributed-key-generation-protocols-3c814e0d47e1), [threshold cryptography](https://medium.com/nethermind-eth/threshold-signature-schemes-36f40bc42aca), homomorphic encryption, [Distributed Validator Technology](https://medium.com/nethermind-eth/sorting-out-distributed-validator-technology-a6f8ca1bbce3), liquid staking, decentralized identity, and more.

Below, we detail some of our successful projects and collaborations with clients, involving renowned Web3-native companies and DAOs in the space:

- We have collaborated with Lido DAO (governance for the largest liquid staking provider on Ethereum) on research projects related to [decentralized identity](https://nethermindeth.github.io/lido_phase_1/index.html) and [dispute resolution](https://www.notion.so/a3bda813d54f4a7b98410dd950e07dbd?pvs=21).
- We are also collaborating with Obol (a pioneer in Distributed Validator Technology on Ethereum) on designing an accountable infrastructure for DVT by leveraging innovative building blocks in cryptography.
- We collaborated with Aleph Zero, using techniques such as zero-knowledge, homomorphic encryption, and multi-party computation to construct [COMMON](https://commondex.docsend.com/view/zab4d4hw4vbb8v7z), a privacy-preserving order book.
- We have conducted fundamental research on the security of existing cryptographic protocols. Our team co-authored [“Fiat-Shamir Security of FRI and Related SNARKs”](https://eprint.iacr.org/2023/1071), which filled a missing gap in the literature on proving the security properties of widely adopted protocols, such as Plonky2 and Redshift.
- We have developed a novel zkSNARK called “[Vampire](https://eprint.iacr.org/2022/406)”, that has the shortest proof among all updatable and universal zkSNARKs.

# Objectives and timeline

Our general objective is to evaluate each of the 3 solutions provided to Nouns DAO in response to the Private Voting Research Sprint, offering a comparison accessible to non-domain experts and opinionated, well-founded advice on the next steps to follow by Nouns DAO. 

To achieve this goal, we propose the following specific objectives:

1. **Evaluate the correctness of each of the 3 deliverables presented to Nouns DAO.**
    - In this objective, we will analyze each of the deliverables, to provide independent verification of their claims and accuracy. The team will highlight any concerns that are found with any of the deliverables’ claims, if any.
    - This task will take 2 weeks.
2. **Identify the technical trade-offs in each of the presented solutions**
    - Here, we identify and underscore any design choices made in each of the solutions that lead to relevant trade-offs. Some areas to consider will include, but are not necessarily limited to, the following:
        - **Operation costs:** Does the solution require running any separate infrastructure? What are the gas costs for the end user? Is there any need for collateral?
        - **Implementation complexity:** What are the dependencies and “moving parts” of each solution? Does this bring up any concerns regarding the feasibility of implementation or its cost?
        - **Time to vote and settlement:** How long does it take a user to submit a vote with this platform? How long does it take for the private voting mechanism to come to a definitive tally of the votes?
        - **Trust assumptions:** What parts of the mechanism require trust in any parties to function correctly?
        - **UX**: How likely is a DAO member to be able to use this seamlessly? What are the expected points of friction for the layperson when interacting with the solution?
        - **Privacy/anonymity:** How exactly is the solution private? For example, is it hidden whether someone voted or not?
        - **Other features of voting systems:** In case we identify differences in the three voting solutions over the following points, they will be included as well:
            - Can a voter with multiple Nouns split his voting power over more than one option?
            - Is the voter able to convince a third party of the fact that he voted? What about the direction of his vote? If so, when does this happen: before or after tallying?
            - Can a user modify his vote after casting an initial vote, but before the election ends? (Useful for coercion resistance)
            - Once the tallying is finished, should the election be verifiable (anyone can re-compute the tally) by any party (universal verifiability) or just by people who participated in the election?
            - What kind of verifiability do these systems provide for the voters regarding the status of their vote?
                - Cast as sent.
                - Recorded as cast.
                - Tallied as recorded.
    - This task will take 2 weeks.
3. **Compare the 3 solutions in light of the trade-offs above.**
    - Next, we utilize the metrics stated in the previous objective, along with any other relevant metrics identified during the study, to provide a comparative analysis of the proposed solutions.
    - This task will take 1 week.
4. **Discuss the road to production for each deliverable.**
    - Given the analysis of the deliverables above, as well as the assessment of technical trade-offs, we will highlight the roadblocks found towards a design usable in production (with good UX) of each of the 3 solutions. We will provide our general recommendations on how the roadblocks could be removed, when possible. Otherwise, we will point out any impossibilities or needs for additional research work in amending the design.
    - This task will take 1 week
5. **Examine the optimality of each solution in accordance with the goals proposed by Nouns DAO.**
    - Finally, we will examine each solution in light of the goals proposed by Nouns DAO in the specification provided during the call for proposals. Using this information, along with the results of the previous objectives, we will provide our conclusions and suggestions.
    - This task will take 1 week.
6. **Discuss the obtained deliverable with Nouns DAO** 
    - After preparing the report (and allowing for a prudential period for review), the team will host a public discussion with Nouns DAO members, asking them to read the content and ask any questions they have about the report. In this way, we want to assist the Nouns community in understanding and getting value from the deliverable. The team will incorporate feedback received by Nouns members on the clarity of the deliverable to facilitate this process.
    - We will allow a period of 2 weeks after delivery for the DAO members to familiarize themselves with the report. We will incorporate the feedback received over a period of 1 week.

# Deliverable

Our deliverable will be a report including the following sections:

1. An overview of each solution that comments on the used building blocks, as well as the solution’s correctness and technical feasibility.
2. An analysis of the technical trade-offs of each solution in light of the metrics established in objective 2.
3. A comparative table illustrating how each solution scores according to each of the metrics established in objective 2.
4. A discussion on the obstacles, if any, towards a design usable in production (with good UX) for each of the 3 solutions.
5. A comparative table evaluating how well each solution satisfies each of the goals proposed by Nouns DAO in the specification provided during the call for proposals.
6. Conclusions from the analyses and comparisons above, along with suggestions for the DAO’s next steps regarding the three proposed solutions.

# Team

To perform the study, Nethermind proposes a team of researchers experienced in the analysis, design, and application of blockchain and cryptography tools. The team will have the following members (in last-name alphabetical order):

**Jorge Arce-Garro**: Ph.D. candidate in Applied Mathematics at the University of Michigan, with research experience in quantum computing, control theory, and machine learning. At Nethermind, he has specialized in the analysis and design of blockchain protocols and applications. Most recently, Jorge led a team that designed a mechanism for decentralized maintenance of Lido’s validator set. (See the [research proposal](https://research.lido.fi/t/a-proposal-for-partnering-with-nethermind-to-design-a-mechanism-for-good-validator-set-maintenance-phase-2/3668) and [deliverable](https://www.notion.so/a3bda813d54f4a7b98410dd950e07dbd?pvs=21)).

**Antonio Manuel Larriba Flor:** Ph.D. in Cryptography, specifically focusing on electronic voting and anonymous identification. With over eight years of experience in academic research and five years of professional engagement in the blockchain environment (including Ethereum, Polkadot, and Cosmos). Antonio has worked on trustless bridging between ecosystems and privacy-focused projects based on zero knowledge. For further details, you can check his CV at: https://github.com/Fantoni0/Fantoni0.github.io/blob/master/doc/cv.pdf.

**Aikaterini-Panagiota Stouka**: Ph.D. in Computer Science at the University of Edinburgh. Thesis title: "[Incentives in Blockchain Protocols](https://era.ed.ac.uk/handle/1842/38227)." Bachelor in Mathematics and MSc. in Computer Science. Over eight years of experience in blockchain research. Experience as a Research Associate at the Blockchain Technology Laboratory at the University of Edinburgh and by collaborating with the Input-output global company on designing the reward mechanism that was implemented in the "Shelley update"' on the Cardano blockchain platform. List of publications: https://dblp.org/pid/184/9142.html.

**Michał Zając**. Ph.D. in Computer Science. Head of Research at Nethermind. Over ten years in cryptography research — both in academia and industry. Doing blockchain-related research since 2018 with a focus on user privacy. The main area of specialization: zero-knowledge proofs, their applications, and security. Co-author of Vampire — an updatable and universal zkSNARK with the shortest proof. List of publications: https://dblp.org/pid/02/6977.html, CV: https://github.com/mpzajac/about_me/blob/main/cv_2023.pdf 

# Timeline and commercials

- Preparing the deliverable before the community call will take 7 weeks.
- The community call will take place 2 weeks after the deliverable’s preparation.
- The final report will be presented 1 week after the community call.

*(Note that the team will be on vacation during the 2 weeks from Dec 23rd to Jan 7th.)*

The project will have a cost of $51800, to be covered by NounsDAO. Kindly note that a 5% discount has been applied to the cost.

# Three Bronouns The Series: A Slapstick Comedy Series about Chip, Beer & Squid

![image alt](https://i.ibb.co/DDDv1z0/GIF-Batch1-layout01-threebornouns-v2.gif) 
### ***Bringing Joy through Laughter with Three Bronouns!***
# **TL;DR**
In our effort to create unique and entertaining content, we would like to submit a funding proposal of ***$39,800 USDC*** to produce a slapstick comedy series featuring the three Nouns brother with their unique characteristics. This proposal involves the creation of ***5 episodes***, each lasting ***2-3 minutes***, to be broadcasted on ***YouTube*** and provided ***Droposal on Zora***. The production process is expected to be completed within ***4 months*** from the approval of the proposal.

# **Our Journey Start from Nouns Short Stories Prop House**
![image alt](https://i.ibb.co/yBJcCDz/1.png)

Three Bronouns emerged from our award-winning creativity in the [Nouns Stories Prop House Season 1](https://prop.house/nouns-stories/nouns-short-shorts-season-1/4182). With a total of 136 votes, this animated work secured the ***2nd position***, demonstrating its appeal and quality. Subsequently, Three Bronouns was featured in The LA Nouns Short Shorts and accepted by [Zora](https://zora.co/collect/eth:0xd64ce3231839fed12c0ee132d6b33b4238ff9929/2), marking the success of our project in delivering entertaining content through unique Nouns characters.
![image alt](https://i.ibb.co/6Fs4XfP/Green-Yellow-Modern-Online-Business-Webinar-Banner-1920-x-1080-px.png)

And here's the funny of the Three Bronouns on Prop House's Nouns Short Stories. Check out the full animation ***[here!](https://youtu.be/vb3fb4yNmbg)***
![image alt](https://i.ibb.co/XtqVdJx/Untitled-design-12.gif)

# **WTF Next? Three Bronouns The Series!**

![image alt](https://i.ibb.co/BfDXHHr/GIF-Batch1-layout02-wft-next-v1.gif)
### **Genre and Inspiration** 
Three Bronouns The Series is a humorous tale about three sibling Nouns – Chip, Beer, and Squid – facing funny incidents in their everyday lives. With a genre encompassing **slapstick**, **comedy**, and **fiction**, this animation is designed to be enjoyed by all ages, from children to teenagers. We draw inspiration from renowned slapstick animations such as **Tom & Jerry**, **Larva**, **Shaun The Sheep**, and **Pink Panther**, aiming to bring joy through laughter.
### **Main Goals**
Our main goal is to spread the influence of nouns through animation on social media, particularly YouTube. We chose this platform for its accessibility and our team's experience in creating and broadcasting content there. We also plan to use Zora to create a Droposal with a minting fee of **$2** for **each episode**, with the aim of supporting charitable activities for children in need.

# **Character, Synopsis, and Storyboard**
### **Character Development**
![image alt](https://i.ibb.co/tLCzbSH/Green-Yellow-Modern-Online-Business-Webinar-Banner-1920-x-1080-px.png)
* **Chip**
    Chip embodies **Noun 156** and features a chipboard head. The character is adorned with red glasses, a black suit, and a purple tie. Chip exudes a cool, elegant attitude and maintains an innocent persona. Among the three brothers, Chip is the eldest sibling.
* **Beer**
    Representing **Noun 12**, Beer is characterized as someone who frequently engages in humorous antics, intentionally creating situations that showcase the adorable nature of his youngest sibling. Beer's physical form is that of a head with a glass full of beer.
* **Squid**
    Adopted from **Noun 24**, Squid's distinctive feature is a head shaped like a squid. Described as a childlike and endearing character in the story, Squid is the youngest sibling. Many of Squid's behaviors and actions are designed to captivate the audience and elicit laughter.

### **Synopsis and Story Board**
* **Synopsis**
There are three brothers who have different personalities. Chip, Beer, and Squid are the three main characters in this series. They have contrasting personalities. Some are blessed with lucky, persecuted lives to emotions that are always changing. With all kinds of personalities, they encounter interesting events every day. Furthermore, this series will be packaged into 5 episodes. Where there will be interesting stories, unexpected plots and events that are ready to shake the stomach of the audience.
* **Storyboard**
![image alt](https://i.ibb.co/8MDG76r/storyboard-new.jpg)


# **Deliverable**
![image alt](https://i.ibb.co/Pwrc3KN/Green-Yellow-Modern-Online-Business-Webinar-Banner-1920-x-1080-px-1.png)

### **YouTube**
Three Bronouns The Series will be broadcast entirely through the [Official Youtube Account of Three Bronouns](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UClwaWFyY0ri0DVnD1c7Q1WQ). We have chosen YouTube as a primary broadcasting medium because it is the only platform accessible worldwide. Additionally, YouTube serves as a bridge to easily connect the general public with Nouns. We intend to leverage this to capture the interest of YouTube viewers and introduce them to the world of Nouns. To achieve this, we have prepared a YouTube channel, profile picture designs, and YouTube background designs. 
### **Droposal**
Following the bridge we establish through YouTube, our next step is to guide the general public towards Nouns by creating a Droposal on Zora. The Droposal will be crafted for each episode released on YouTube. Our hope is that the 5% of viewers on YouTube will also participate in minting Three Bronouns The Series through the Droposal. We plan to carry out minting with a fee of $2, and all proceeds from minting will be utilized for assistance programs benefiting children in need. This plan is conceived based on the success of our previous initiative, Nounish Holidays. Building on the success of that program, we aim to dedicate all minting proceeds to bring happiness to children who may be lacking in joy.
### **Three Bronouns Coffee Shop Tour**
Coffee shops are currently a favorite place for work, refreshing and even just talking with friends. A comfortable and spacious place will make it easier to conduct meetings. Collaboration with these coffee shop owners is certainly an interesting thing to try. We want to take advantage of it by watching Three Bronouns The Series together. In addition, we also want to socialize about what Nouns is and give door prizes to attract people who come.

Measuring the Success of Three Bronouns The Series

One of the main platforms for airing this series is YouTube. The targets we aim to achieve include views, likes, comments, and subscriptions.

Considering the track record of previous Nouns droposals on Zora, we set a target of ***100+ mints*** for ***each episode***. The customizable page layout and easy accessibility make this target realistic to achieve.

All proceeds from the droposal will be used for charity activities. The target we set is to visit ***4 orphanages***, where a total of ***80+ children*** will experience happiness through Three Bronouns The Series.

We plan to watch Three Bronouns together in at least ***3 coffee shops***. Where the total audience we want to reach is ***75+ visitors***.

# Play Nouns: A Fun Game UI Layer to Keep Nouns Weird

### 🚨IMPORTANT: PLAY [GAME DEMO](https://nounsgame.vercel.app) BEFORE READING PROP!🚨

[![play_nouns](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/Hypk4h7Hp.png)](https://nounsgame.vercel.app)


# 🏃TL;DR

Hi 👋 I'm [Yung Algorithm](http://twitter.com/yungalgorithm/). It's my mission to use technology to help people have fun and connect with each other. I am seeking 22 ETH to complete a fun gamified frontend layer for Nouns called "Play Nouns" over the course of 3 months. The catalyst for building Play Nouns originally was [this tweet by Nounish](https://x.com/nounish/status/1677667046103076864?s=20):

[![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/Bk5q_5pGa.png)](https://x.com/nounish/status/1677667046103076864?s=20)

A fun, gamified layer for Nouns is something the Nouns community has long enthusiastically discussed. The "Play Nouns" game proposed here allows users to do everything they can do on the current Nouns frontends (like [Nouns.WTF](https://www.nouns.wtf) and [Voters.wtf](https://www.voters.wtf/nouns)), but within a nostalgic 8-bit style web game. 

This includes:

* **Governance participation:** including zero weight votes, proposals, and candidates;
* **Daily auction bidding:** for Nouns, Gnars, Lil Nouns, and any Nouns project;
* **Onchain player profiles:** showing onchain activity and voting history for each player;
* **Multiplayer chat:** chat with others around you in the game and build relationships;
* **Mini-games:** hyper-casual and classic games to play with friends;
* **Onboarding quests:** Nouns-pill newcomers into our ecosystem in an interactive way;
* **Access Info:** Access all Nouns resources (github, assets, documents);
* **Event hosting:** A hangout space during live events like TNS, Noun 'O Clock, and more.

By creating a fun, gamified layer for Nouns, we aim to best facililate the playing of Nouns as an "Infinite Game" (as defined by [lil panda](https://twitter.com/lilpandawtf) and [index](https://twitter.com/modrovsky) on the [Let's Play Lil Nouns Podcast](https://www.youtube.com/@lilpandawtf/featured)) for both holders and non-holders alike.

*If you have time to read the full prop, please continue. If you are rushed and just want the TL;DR -- we are building a fun gamified layer for Nouns so we can do onchain activities and hang out in a game environment, and "Play Nouns" like we are playing Runescape or Pokemon -- a game-like frontend for new and exciting Nouns projects to grow and proliferate. The demo is already playable ([pls play it for 1 min if you haven't already](https://nounsgame.vercel.app)), and the ask is 22 ETH for a 3 month runway to build the demo out into a production version.*

# 🎮 Why Play Nouns?

## To further connect the community

[TNS](https://tns.wtf), [Nounish](https://www.nounish.world), [Gnars](https://www.gnars.wtf), and [Nouns Esports](https://nouns.gg) are great examples of cultural outputs that signify the direction Nouns is collectively headed, and more will come as Nouns continues to proliferate. The game proposed here serves as a place to host and connect all of the Nounish outputs outside of conventional websites and social media, in a fun and truly Nounish way. More importantly, web games like Runescape and World of Warcraft allow for people connect with each other in a digital world and develop relationships outside of the game itself, and this is the main aim of this proposal -- to build a game layer abstraction to represent the 'meta-game' of playing Nouns, e.g. governance participation and auction bidding.

## To "Keep Nouns Weird"

Keeping with [9999's](https://twitter.com/lastpunk9999/status/1629122171682402307) "Keep Nouns Weird" slogan, game-like frontend UIs are a great area for exploration online, especially within web3 (see the success of [DeFi Kingdoms](https://defikingdoms.com) and even AMMs like [PancakeSwap](https://pancakeswap.finance)). Nouns is an ideal candidate, given its brand identity, and doing onchain activities through a game-like UI is a natural next step to progress the DAO forward and lead by example. We expect UIs to become [more and more gamelike](https://www.toptal.com/designers/gui/game-ui) in the coming years, and [gaming as an industry is growing hand-over-foot](https://www.statista.com/outlook/dmo/digital-media/video-games/worldwide). Currently, it is about three times larger than both the [music](https://www.globenewswire.com/news-release/2023/08/15/2725967/0/en/Music-Market-Size-Share-Analysis-Growth-Trends-Forecasts-2023-2028.html#:~:text=The%20music%20industry%20has%20reached%20a%20new%20level%20of%20internationalization.&text=%2F%3Futm_source%3DGNW-,The%20Music%20Market%20size%20is%20expected%20to%20grow%20from%20USD,period%20(2023%2D2028).) and [film & TV](https://www.zionmarketresearch.com/report/global-movies-entertainment-market) industries combined. We have already seen good success from the [Nouns Esports team](https://nouns.gg).

## To engage new users and DAO members

New creators, contributors, and ecosystem members are the lifeblood of Nouns and its sub-DAOs, and a gamified frontend layer allows for a fun way to lure new members into the world of Nouns to engage and contribute. The game supports Candidate submission and zero-weight voting, and game loops (in-game points, items, and leaderboard high scores) can incentivize non-Nouns-holders to participate in governance. As for existing DAO members, while many power users may still opt for text-based frontends for voting, the proposed game serves as a gamified option in addition to from frontend governance UIs ([nouns.wtf](https://www.nouns.wtf), [voters.wtf](https://www.voters.wtf/nouns)) and social media ([discord](https://discord.com/invite/nouns), [farcaster](https://warpcast.com/~/channel/nouns), [twitter](https://twitter.com/nounsdao), and [discourse forums](https://discourse.nouns.wtf)) for DAO members to have fun, create content, build relationships, and share ideas in a fun and interactive way.

## To build on top of existing cc0 and funded proposals

[David](https://twitter.com/davidbrai) and [Elad](https://twitter.com/eladmallel) from Verbs recently [published a post on Mirror](https://mirror.xyz/verbsteam.eth/vyhDmS56XvnIBFUQ65n_KgmYzkD88-UHxUitxRGw08o) discussing their views on why deprecating the currently unmaintained Nouns.wtf frontend is a sensible move. They argue in favor of incentivizing new alternative frontend UIs for the DAO. This proposal also builds on [Prop 201](https://nouns.wtf/vote/201), which funded the creation of Nouns spritesheets ([finished product linked here](https://spritesheetcenter.vercel.app)). These spritesheets are used so people can select their Noun(s) as playable characters in the game (non-holders get to choose other Nouns/sub-DAO skins). This proposal seeks to build what ecosystem members are talking about, and execute on a vision of a fun layer for Nouns discovery, interaction, and gamified governance.

# 💸 Roadmap and Funding

22 ETH, broken up in the following way:

- 15 ETH: 3 months' compensation to Yung Algorithm to ship the roadmap below;
- 4 ETH: Game assets (commissioned from Nouns ecosystem artists);
- 2 ETH: Marketing budget for game release;
- 1 ETH: 12 months' runway for operational expenses (server costs and gas fees)

The below roadmap is broken down into a demo sprint (already completed), 3 month-long production sprints, and then a placeholder for additional sprints:

## ✅ Demo Sprint: Month 0
🟢 Overworld Map
🟢 8 custom-made 8-bit soundtracks for each area of the game (composed by Yung Algorithm)
🟢 School Map
🟢 Auction Map
🟢 Proposal House Map
🟢 Gnars DAO Map
🟢 Lil Nouns Map
🟢 Arcade Map
🟢 CC0 Nouns Spritesheets (e.g. the animations of Nouns NPCs in the game)
🟢 Questline
🟢 Minigames
🟢 WalletConnect (Metamask only)

## 🟦 Production Sprint I: Month 1
🔵 CC0 Nouns game assets (work with Nouns artists like [Ilustradora](https://twitter.com/ilustradoraeth), [Brett](https://twitter.com/brettdrawsstuff), [Carlos](https://twitter.com/greta_gremplin), etc.)
🔵 Onchain logic functionality (bid, vote, check ownership, etc)
🔵 Nouns player profiles (unique onchain histories of each Noun holder)
🔵 New minigames (demo only includes simple casino games + battle game)
🔵 Multiplayer Functionality (so players can see each other walking around the map)
🔵 Chat Functionality (so players can chat with each other, both directly and to a 'game chat')
🔵 In-game items and currency (eg. as rewards for onchain, quest, minigame participation)
🔵 Interactive HUD (show player health, Treasury balance, # of in-game currency, etc)
🔵 Event Space map (where people can see tweets, events, streams happen in real-time and have viewing parties)
🔵 WalletConnect Functionality (right now only MetaMask is supported)
🔵 Social API plug-in (twitter, discord, farcaster, discourse forums)

## 🟦 Production Sprint II: Month 2
🔵 Gather community feedback and iterate (e.g. add new areas, functionalities, features, quests, minigames, update assets)
🔵 Conceieve of launch/marketing plan to debut Nouns Game publicly

## 🟦 Production Sprint III: Month 3
🔵 Gather community feedback and iterate (e.g. add new areas, functionalities, features, quests, minigames, update assets)
🔵 Execute on launch/marketing plan and debut Nouns Game to web3 ecosystem

## 🟦 Additional Production Sprints: TBD (not in scope for this proposal)
🔵 Produce and distribute a batch of gameboy-like handheld game consoles to "Play Nouns" as a holiday drop for Christmas 2024, potentially in collaboration with Nouns ecosystem hardware builders (e.g. [Tigris](https://twitter.com/tigrisli)/[Lychee](https://twitter.com/lycheevision))
🔵 Release Nouns Game natively on App Store (iOS) or Google Playstore (Android)
🔵 Etc...

![rg35xx](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/B1EhnpaMa.png)

# 🧑‍🔬 Tech Specs

Play Nouns is a React app hosted on [Vercel](http://vercel.com). It talks to the [Nouns Subgraph](https://thegraph.com/hosted-service/subgraph/nounsdao/nouns-subgraph) for onchain data (for proposals and Noun information) and social APIs for social integration (twitter, discord, farcaster, and the discourse RSS feed). It connects with your wallet using [WalletConnect](http://walletconnect.com), which supports multiple wallet providers. The game assets and codebase will all be cc0 and public on github respectively.

## Technical Diagram

![tech](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/BJ2zka7HT.png)

## Multi Compatibility

The game engine compiles to native android and iOS in addition to web, meaning the codebase need not need be updated or rewritten for compatibility in the future if we want to implement the handheld gaming console mentioned above, or a native iOS/android app. This also allows for exciting compatibility with handheld gaming devices which run on android (like the RG35XX pictured above).

# A Nounish Coffee Shop — A Los Angeles IRL-to-URL Nounish Experience


 **TL;DR**
 We’re terraforming LA and spreading positive sum crypto culture and Nounish values.

This proposal seeks $650,000 USDC to establish and operate a Nouns-branded coffee shop in Marina Del Rey, Los Angeles. This proposal includes acquiring an existing coffee shop, transforming it with a Nounish identity, giving away free coffee at Noun O’Clock, funding a series of community events, and creating a global online presence. Our team, with over 20 years in hospitality and retail, will ensure a seamless transition of an existing coffee shop into a vibrant Nounish hub.

After the initial funding, the coffee shop will be able to sustain itself indefinitely and continue providing Nounish events and activations.

**The Coffee Shop ⌐◧-◧**

![](https://lh7-us.googleusercontent.com/gIG_oeVZTa0PcWNMxW_TX-paYVvK8fgetM0fzu9w-_WYykfVl26FScjsJahKBXeWnrvK5qV2dw7KVcVGyxBC1SYlPqUGOpmDSFg02BUFrUOrmmkvxoAGbxRZ9X4_BamAIBSrBEhk5RU8To7nm8m1Zwo)

Located 15-minutes away from LAX, the coffee shop is nestled in the Marina Del Rey neighborhood of Los Angeles and has been serving the community for three years. More than just a local favorite, the shop offers something unique in the world of coffee: A 'Pure Espresso' system which uses batched and bottle espresso. This technology isn't new to us; the proposing team has [already deployed this espresso onchain](https://www.happyfriday.coffee/) via [The Park](https://thepark.wtf/), a Nounish subDAO.

Beyond espresso, the shop makes nearly everything from scratch, including sourdough bread, bagels, pies, cakes, biscuits, and more. In addition to this, they have a dinner menu and a specialized list of wine.

**Nounish Transformation and CC0 culture ⌐◧-◧**

The transformation will include a complete rebranding to reflect Nouns' identity, with a focus on the things that Nouns represents within a creative, inviting atmosphere. We will give the shop a new Nounish name and incorporate Nounish art both within the branding and the shop itself. Our goal is to create an immersive experience that showcases Nouns culture while also fitting into the city of Los Angeles.

![](https://lh7-us.googleusercontent.com/oBX06N3glbfnvdtJUyUhBa7AU5Ttye43Kg-xhq6SJUXZA18dcPTUZqNR83sz75n2Lm1jKRRUsgNgwIB8HsKdpwtog755QMVEskvNuND4Zwl1sJvwDvjOs8xWlFkNvqvdJHUzkFPWENqbfB0pF-WE-bE)

In line with Nouns' CC0 culture, we will make our unique recipes, branding, and business model openly available to promote industry transparency and community-driven growth.

**Making Coffee a Public Good ⌐◧-◧**

Every day at Noun O’Clock, we’ll offer free coffee for guests. This allows the shop to create a moment, each day, that’s special for its community. It's something only a Nouns-funded coffee shop can do: aligning its daily routine with the heartbeat of Nouns itself. This will allow the coffee shop to both strengthen the Nouns brand and do something cool and unique that sets us apart. Small gestures can have a big impact. Let’s make Noun O’Clock a new daily ritual.

**The Team ⌐◧-◧**

Derek G Taylor brings a wealth of experience and creativity to the proposing team. As an owner and partner of [Menotti’s Coffee Stop](https://www.instagram.com/menottis/?hl=en), he has successfully helped manage and expand this popular coffee brand since its inception in 2013, now boasting three locations, with two in Los Angeles and an international spot in Tokyo. Derek's expertise isn't limited to traditional coffee shop operations; he has also made a significant impact in the festival scene, with Menotti’s having a regular presence at festivals major events like Coachella and Camp Flog Gnaw.

In the web3 space, Derek is an early founder and staff member of [Friends With Benefits (FWB](https://www.fwb.help/)), and a founder of [The Park](https://nouns.build/dao/ethereum/0x96e396e66087b2b9dcad36fd473e1b049df18998/337), a Nounish DAO focused on music, art, and coffee. [⌐Ⓗ-Ⓕ Coffee](https://www.happyfriday.coffee/) and [Lil Nouns Coffee](https://lilnouns.coffee/) are two of his pioneering explorations in utilizing NFTs, DAO mechanics, and Nounish branding to create products within the coffee world.

Drew Coffman's built [Evergreen](https://www.instagram.com/evergreen.rdd), a leading coffee shop and boutique hotel in Redding, CA. His hands-on experience in taking over, expanding, and rebranding an existing coffee business into a beloved community staple highlights his skill in turnkey operations and his ability to evaluate market trends and customer needs.

Drew has been active in web3 since 2020, working with notable organizations like [Base](https://base.org/) and [FWB](https://www.fwb.help/). He worked with artist Dustin Yellin to create [an Open Edition](https://opensea.io/collection/dyppt) of [Person, Place, or Thing](https://twitter.com/dustinyellin/status/1686106445412978688), Yellin’s Nounish art piece, gaining notable recognition on OpenSea’s home page and at FWB FEST ‘23. Additionally, Drew has experience in creating [engaging content about Nouns](https://zora.co/collect/eth:0x024c14ca63ff1ab594a76579bf5c35fe030b16c4) and participated as [a delegate for Noun 652](https://x.com/WilsonCusack/status/1641121423409201152?s=20) where he consistently voted with reason.

Together, Derek and Drew’s extensive background in coffee shop management and event curation, combined with their passion for Nouns, DAOs, and the web3 ecosystem, form the backbone of the team. Their complementary skills and shared vision for a Nouns-centric coffee experience make them uniquely equipped to bring this innovative project to life in Los Angeles.

**About Pure Espresso, Scaling, and Franchising ⌐◧-◧**

![](https://lh7-us.googleusercontent.com/JJBR1LzK929BbGx_pnj2ishgsR4bZdg_tbuG4m3l18FPeOBc8tfuhz4AKHtoQXqb7TLIOG6X_U2i9Z7YyAQV08Y7qwFPDkRyBLXADOH7veoekHpc2J0IWy-Id5DGGToweu-rbYwKP-RmWvSdVEVaDTM)

'Pure Espresso' sets the shop apart. This innovative, zero-waste espresso reduces coffee usage by 20-30% and cuts energy consumption by 70%, all while ensuring a consistent and high-quality product. This operational efficiency allows us to focus more on customer engagement and less on the complexities of traditional coffee preparation without a drop in quality.

The Nouns coffee shop will be a scalable model, potentially expanding globally without franchise fees. Pure Espresso technology simplifies operations, making it an attractive option for future franchisees. We will implement a thorough quality control process, ensuring any future Nouns coffee shops maintain the same high standards.

**Community Engagement, DAO Education, and Retail ⌐◧-◧**

Our vision extends beyond coffee. We aim to use the Nouns coffee shop as a platform for DAO education and community engagement. Interactive elements like QR codes on coffee cups will direct customers to Nouns content and initiatives, turning our coffee sales into an educational tool.

We will develop a line of Nouns coffee merchandise, including a signature 'Nouns Espresso Blend.' We'll also collaborate with other Noun holders, offering them a platform to showcase their products, thus fostering a deeper community connection.

**Why LA ⌐◧-◧**

Los Angeles, a global hub for culture, innovation, and creativity, presents the ideal location for a Nouns-branded coffee shop. Known for its vibrant arts and entertainment scene, Los Angeles is home to many creative minds —artists, designers, tech innovators, and filmmakers — all of which would benefit from becoming a part of the Nouns ecosystem. LA also has a burgeoning tech scene, with many members of the web3 community already rooted here, making it fertile ground for events and activations.

Marina Del Rey’s location within LA is strategic: it's a neighborhood centrally located within the westside, with high foot traffic from both locals and tourists. The presence of prominent businesses like Costco, In & Out, and the Waterside and Villa Marina shopping plazas in the vicinity creates a bustling environment ideal for a new coffee shop. Moreover, the absence of competing specialty coffee shops in the immediate area offers a unique opportunity to establish the Nouns coffee shop as a go-to destination. This is the perfect place for a coffee shop to thrive, within a city at the forefront of the global stage.

**Risk and Contingency Plan ⌐◧-◧**

The existing profitability of the café minimizes financial risk. Our experienced team is well-equipped to manage the transition and maintain the café's success. We've allocated funds for contingencies and unexpected expenses to ensure smooth operations.

Budget and Funding Details

The $650,000 USDC budget is allocated as follows:

-  Acquisition and ownership transfer of existing café: $300,000
    

	-  	 This amount is allocated for the acquisition of the existing coffee shop business. This strategic move eliminates the need for the extensive costs associated with permitting and a complete build-out, and includes around $70,000 in high-quality equipment, such as refrigerators, freezers, ovens, coffee brewers, and cutting-edge steam wands. Additionally, we will inherit existing licenses, crucial for the sale of food, beer and wine, setting the stage for a smooth transition to Nouns Coffee House.
    

-   Nounish makeover and renovation: $150,000
    

	-   To transition the coffee shop into a space that truly reflects Nouns, we plan a temporary closure of 2-3 months for a complete makeover. This budget covers a comprehensive rebranding to align with the Nouns identity, inclusive of new signage, merchandise, packaging, and an interior redesign that resonates with the Nouns aesthetic.
    
-   Initial staffing, training, and Nouns culture integration: $150,000
    
	-   With the goal of making the coffee shop a beacon for the Nouns community in a city teeming with creatives, this budget is designated for recruitment, training, and integration of Nouns culture into our daily operations. We want every team member to be knowledgeable and enthusiastic about Nouns, ready to engage and educate customers about our unique community and ethos.
    

-   Operational reserves for contingencies and unforeseen costs: $50,000
    

	-   In recognition of the unpredictability inherent in any business venture, this reserve fund is set aside to address unforeseen costs and challenges. This proactive budgeting ensures that unexpected expenses do not hinder the launch and operation of the Nouns coffee shop, allowing us to maintain our focus on providing an exceptional Nounish experience.
    

**ROI and Long-Term Vision ⌐◧-◧**

This is more than a coffee shop; it's a sustainable investment in spreading the Nouns message. We foresee it becoming an essential part of the Nouns ecosystem, attracting new members and providing unique engagement opportunities.

We're thrilled about the prospect of bringing Nouns to life in Los Angeles, setting the stage for a global network of Nouns coffee. We want to create a dynamic, physical representation of Nouns and its values.
